loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a resident of Kiruhura district.  She has five children who all go to school. She got married when she was 17 to a man she loved, and the parents were against it. The husband had no source of income and looking after the children became a problem.  She and her husband joined hands to work in the neighbors’ banana plantations to earn a living until they managed to plant their own banana garden. That is when she got to know of Ugafode micro finance and acquired a loan of 500,000 which helped her buy another piece of land to expand their banana plantation. Unfortunately, their plantation is now affected with banana wilt disease and they are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 to buy pesticides for it.  The balance will be used to clear the school fees balance. In the photograph, Beatrice is standing with her husband.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and to buy pesticides

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Betty from Torpoi town  Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children, 5 years and 12 years. One of her children is going to school.  In 2009, Betty established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to create income to improve her standard of living. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and inadequate funds.

Betty requires a loan in order to purchase tooth paste, rice and soft drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Betty plans to improve her shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase tooth paste, rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Marie from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children between the ages of 5 and 13 years. Her children are currently attending school. In 2008, Marie established her fish business. She began her business because she needs to create her own source of income instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting the fish.  It is very difficult because sometimes the vehicle breaks on the way.  

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Marie plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bus tires for transport business

loans.name: Doris Yessenia

texts.es:
Doris Yessenia es una joven de 28 años, casada, madre de un pequeño de 3 años, habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde fue nacida y criada.

Se recibió como maestra de primaria y actualmente estudia Ciencias Sociales porque le gusta aprender todo lo relacionado de la historia de Nicaragua para luego enseñarles a sus futuros alumnos y por ende tener un mejor salario con esta especialidad.

Labora como profesora en un centro de estudio de primaria donde tiene seis años de laborar, labor que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y darle lo necesario a su hijo.

En este momento está necesitando del apoyo de los inversionistas del extranjero para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito para mejorar la salud de su pequeño hijo, ya que quiere llevarlo donde el pediatra, un médico especialista en niños privado ubicado en la ciudad de León y así adquirir el medicamento necesario y realizarle los exámenes médicos para combatir la enfermedad.

Tiene la esperanza que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud.
texts.en:
Doris Yessenia is a young woman who is 28-years old.  She is married and the mother of a 3-year old little boy.  She lives in the municipality of El Sauce, where she was born and raised. 

Doris Yessenia graduated as a primary school teacher.  She is currently studying Social Sciences.  She likes to learn everything she can about Nicaragua's history so she can later teach it her students.  She will also earn a better salary with a specialty. 

She works as a teacher in a primary school.  She has worked there for six years.  The job allows her to provide for her family and give her son everything he needs. 

At this time, Doris Yessenia needs foreign investor support because Ceprodel provided her with a loan to help with her young son's health.  She wants to bring him to a pediatrician, a private doctor in the city León who specializes in treating children.  She would then be able to get the medication and testing he needs to combat his illness. 

Doris Yessenia has hope that these good-hearted people will grant her request.

loans.use: to purchase medications and get some testing done.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, él comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc.  para seguir con sus cosechas y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives with his life partner and their children. He farms; specifically, he grows corn and beans. He has been working in agriculture for years and has acquired valuable experience that has led to great harvests. His land is located in an agricultural zone, and he sells in all the local areas. He has regular customers, who always prefer his merchandise because it is high quality and affordable

He wants to take advantage of his growing business to increase production and, thereby, earn more income. He needs to buy supplies but lacks capital. He has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seed, manure, pesticide, tools, and more so that he can continue harvesting and giving his family members whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, pesticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 31 years old and married with 1 child, age 4 years. She has two other relatives at home. She runs a palm oil business in Moriba town Bo, in Sierra Leone. She began her business when she dropped out of school, and she wants to help her parents make a living. 

To earn a living, she sells palm oil at a particular place. She does not have any source of income except her business. She says that in spite of her family's poverty level she desires to further her education.  

Martina requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her family's welfare. In the future, she would like to change her business to a provision shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 58 years old. He lives in the Kutaisi district with his 32-year-old son, Shalva, and his daughter-in-law. Ramaz requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Shalva is working as a singer at the local restaurant. His wife is a cook. They both get small monthly salaries that are the only source of income for the family.

Ramaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Ramaz will start trading in household goods and clothes. He will go to Turkey to purchase everything at wholesale prices, bring it to his district, and sell among the villagers with a price markup. Shalva will work as hard as he can to earn a good profit and provide a better life for his family. He will reinvest part of the profit into the same field to purchase more products and offer better choices to his clients. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading in household goods and clothes.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
Сураё честная и добропорядочная женщина.  Живет в Гафуровском районе.  Замужем и имеет двоих прекрасных детей. У них очень дружная и счастливая семья.  Несколько лет назад старший сын Сурае уехал на заработки в Российскую Федерацию, так как не смог найти работу на своей родине.  Он каждый месяц старается посылать родителям денежные средства.  Муж Сурае является сварщиком, зарабатывает он мало.  Сама Сурае занимается выращиванием скота.  Ее муж помогает ей в купле продаже скота. Этот бизнес дает им хорошую прибыль.  
Сын Сурае планирует вернуться в следующим  году и жениться, поэтому Сурае хочет по возвращению сына отремонтировать дом.  Пока накопленных денежных средств не хватает. Сурае решила обратиться в организацию Арванд и подать заявку на кредит. Она хочет купить еще скот и увеличить стадо, и осенью продав откормленных скотов   начать ремонт дома.   Сурае очень надеется на финансовую поддержку со стороны Арванд и в реализации  своих планов.
texts.en: Surayo is an honest and respectable woman.  She lives in the Gafurov region.  She is married and has two wonderful children. They have a very friendly and happy family.  Several years ago, Surayo's oldest son left home to work in Russia because he could not find a job in his homeland.   Every month, he tries to send his parents some money.  Surayo's husband is a welder, and he makes little money.  Surayo herself raises cattle.  Her husband assists her with the purchase and sale of cattle. This business provides them with a good profit.  Surayo's son plans to return the next year and get married.  Because of this, Surayo wants to repair the home in time for his return.  Right now, she does not have enough savings to do this.  Surayo decided to turn to the  Avrand organization and request a loan application.  She wants to buy more cattle and increase her herd, and then re-sell the cattle she has fattened up in autumn and begin to repair her home. Surayo very much hopes for financial support from Avrand and wishes to make her plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: The borrower has been a farmer for 7 years, and this has given her the capacity and the knowledge necessary to help her crops. Her main crops are corn and sorghum. She sells her crops at agencies close to her place of residence that buy and sell staple grains. With the earnings she obtains, she helps with her family's costs. She lives in her own house with her partner and their two children. The borrower is asking for a loan to be able to buy farming supplies that will help her in planting her crops, such as manure, seed, and fertilizer. She will thus be able to make more of a profit and continue helping with her household's costs without limitations.

loans.use: to buy manure, seed, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en:
Lonah is 28 years old.  She is married to Daniel and supports five people.  She runs a food business in Kericho town.  This has been her income-generating business for the last three years.  She gets an average monthly profit of Kshs 6,000. 

She is borrowing Kshs 10,000, and with this loan she intends to purchase more stock of green maize and vegetables and other foodstuffs for sale. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business by opening a small canteen to sell fruits and many types of vegetables.
Lonah hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable.  She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a cereals trader in Tala town and has been in this business for six years. She also has a maize mill and she sells maize flour to various customers in the area. She is 51 years old, widowed and has four children. Besides the cereals business, she also rears cattle.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to buy more stock of maize to sell. She also plans to buy more feeds for her cattle. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to be grow her business and be a successful business lady.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es: Rigoberto a sus 50 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol  y adicional a esto trabaja de albañil, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha ganado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde siembra esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un buen servicio; don Rigoberto siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, desea realizar  una nueva inversión que le permita aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, café, abono, insecticida, herramientas, etc. don rigoberto tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 50, grows corn and beans and is also a bricklayer. He has been farming for several years and has garnered valuable experience, which has led to great harvests. His land is located in an agricultural area close to his house. He sells in all the surrounding communities and has regular customers, who prefer buying from him because he offers high quality merchandise at affordable prices and good service.

Rigoberto is always looking for chances to be successful. He wants to make a new investment that will increase production and has applied to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn, bean, and coffee seeds, manure, pesticide, tools, etc. Rigoberto has good credit references and is sure he can pay his debt. He also hopes that he can make his household financially secure.

loans.use: to buy corn, bean, and coffee seeds, manure, pesticide, tools, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 34 years old, married, and a father of one child. For the past five years, he has earned a living by offering point-to-point transport services in Malindi town, from which he earns a monthly profit of about KES 6,050. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his second loan, in the amount of KES 35,000. He is going to use a portion of the loan to service and repair his motorbike and use the remaining amount to purchase a pair of new wheels for his motorcycle. He will use the profits to pay school fees for his child, invest back into his business, and continue looking after his family. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can improve his financial stability.

loans.use: To repair, service, and buy a new pair of wheels for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic works hard to support her family. Marivic is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits to sell.  Marivic has been in this business for 13 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Musalam

texts.ru:
Мусалам очень отзывчивая и добрая женщина. Она воспитывает 3 детей. Ее муж работает в России, но каждый месяц присылает деньги для детей.  Сама Мусалам торгует детской одеждой, у нее  есть магазин который , она сама арендовала  в одном из рынков города.  Она очень любит детей поэтому решила именно торговать детской одеждой.  Раньше поставщики привозили ей товар и это ей обходилась дороже, теперь она решила сама ездить за товаром.  
Мусалам мечтает чтобы ее дети хорошо учились и в будущем работали по профессии.  Она надеется,что в старости ее дети будут ей опорой.  Так как Мусалам решила теперь сама ездить за товаром ей необходимы денежные средства. От знакомых она узнала,что в организации Арванд можно получить кредит и  Мусалам решила подать заявку.  
Это ее первый кредит в  организации  Арванд, поэтому она очень серьезно относиться к получению займа.  На полученный кредит Мусалам планирует закупить новый ассортимент летней детской одежды, и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Musalam is a very attentive and kind woman.  She is raising 3 children.  Her husband works in Russia, but sends home money every month for the children.  Musalam sells children's clothing, and she has a store which she leased herself at one of the markets in town.  She loves children very much, and therefore decided to sell children's clothing.  Earlier, she had her merchandise delivered by vendors, which was more expensive.  She has now decided to go and purchase the merchandise herself.  Musalam dreams that her children receive a good education and work in a professional field in the future.  She hopes that, in her old age, her children can be her support.  Because Musalam has decided to start traveling by herself to purchase merchandise, she needs the financial means to do so. She learned from her friends that she can request a loan from the Avrand organization, and has decided to submit an application.  This is her first loan from Avrand and, because of this, she is very serious about receiving a loan.  She plans to use the loan to purchase a new assortment of children's summer clothing, and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes

loans.name: Youngor

texts.en: Youngor is 28 years old.  She lives in Montserrado County which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia,  She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 3. They live at home and attend school.  She went to school and completed grade 12.  She has been managing her business well for the past ten years, operating a table business which sells frozen chicken, pigs' feet, meat, chicken feet, etc. in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days a week, from 7 am to 5 pm.   Most of the time, she uses the bus to get her ingredients to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken, pigs' feet, meat, and chicken feet to resell. Her plan is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, pig's feet, meat, chicken feet to resell.

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, y cafe  tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, José necesita invertir en insumos pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramienta, etc. y asi seguir con sus cosechas y poder darle a su familia lo que necesita in limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José, 36, lives with his wife and their two children. He makes a living in agriculture, specifically cultivating corn and coffee. He has been working in this field for many years and this experience has been very valuable in allowing him to obtain better harvests. 

His farmland is located in an agriculture-heavy area. He sells in all of the surrounding areas and he already has many steady clients. These people always favor his products because they are quality products at accessible prices, and furthermore, his service is unmatched. 

José needs to invest in supplies but he does not have enough capital, which is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to allow him to buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc. and that way continue with his harvest and be able to give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc.

loans.name: Yujeidy Marcela

texts.es: Yujeidy Marcela es una mujer de 20 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos, es emprendedora y trabajadora. Hace pocos meses tomó la decisión de montar un restaurante de comida casera en un barrio popular del sector, ofreciendo desayunos, almuerzos y comida en general, es dedicada y responsable, labora en arduas jornadas para mantener su negocio bien organizado y sobre todo llevar bien la administración del mismo. Con el crédito que solicita con la Corporación desea comprar ventiladores para alivianar el calor que hace en la ciudad y, adicionalmente invertir en la compra de insumos (verduras, carne, lácteos, granos) para tener disponibilidad suficiente y así poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es hacer crecer su negocio, para atraer a nuevos clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos económicos para seguir apoyando a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Yujeidy Marcela is 20, single, enterprising, and hardworking and does not yet have children. A few months ago, she decided to open a home-style restaurant, serving breakfast, lunch, and other foods, in a popular neighborhood. She is dedicated and responsible and works long days to keep her business operating and, above all, well-managed.

With this loan from the institution, she wants to to buy fans to alleviate the heat and to buy supplies (vegetables, meat, milk products, grains) so that she has enough on hand to offer her customers good service. Her great wish is to grow her business, attract new customers, and generate more income so that she can keep helping her family pay household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fans to alleviate the heat and to buy supplies (vegetables, meat, milk products, grains).

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Adama from Moriba town Bo. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 15 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Adama runs a food stand.  She sells rice, flour, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Adama says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Adama has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her childrens' school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than even. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for sale.

loans.name: Gloria Argentina

texts.es:
Gloria tiene una edad de 37 años es una mujer luchadora y con muchos sueños con una gran familia compuesta por 6 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella y están en la primaria en distintos grados de educación y los otros 3 ya son personas adultas y con familia. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado. La actividad de la agricultura la aprendió por parte de su compañero de hogar el cual la ha apoyado en todo lo necesario para salir adelante y viceversa. La tierra que juntos trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo y la dedicación ubicada a 25 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual en ocasiones se trasladan a pie y e veces en carro. 

Ella se encuentra muy feliz porque se ha acercado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para solicitar un financiamiento para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de café en la que le han abierto las puertas y espera mejorar su cosecha con la compra de fertilizantes, abono, urea, herbicidas, etc. 

Su sueño es formar un patrimonio sólido para sus hijos y las demás generaciones ya que con los años serán ellos quienes queden administrando el negocio de lo que hoy en día ella y su pareja están forjando para su bienestar y para enfrentar las dificultades económicas entre otras de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Gloria, 37 years old, is a woman who is a fighter and has many dreams. She has a large family made up of 6 children. Three of them live with her and are in primary school in different grades, and the other three are already adults with families. She has an incomplete primary school education and attended through third grade. She learned farming from her partner, who has supported her in everything necessary to move ahead and vice versa. The land they work together is their own, thanks to effort and dedication, and is located 25 minutes from the house where they live. Occasionally they get there on foot, and sometimes by car.

She is very happy because she has approached the COMIXMUL cooperative to ask for a loan to provide assistance to her coffee crops and they have opened their doors to her. She hopes to improve her harvest with the purchase of fertilizer, manure, urea, herbicide, etc.

Her dream is to create a solid patrimony for her children and the other generations, since as years pass it will be they who remain to administer the business which today she and her partner are forging for their well-being, and to confront the economic difficulties, among others, in a favorable way.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 42-years-old, and live in Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is married with four children. Unfortunately, Victoria did not go to school, but she manages her business well.  

For the past three years, she has been selling soap, body cream, hair grease, perfume, etc. in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband who sells fire-coal by bag and she enjoy her business because the business gives her money.  She sells six days in a week, from 7am to 5pm, and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more soap, body cream, hair grease, etc. for her business. Her future plans are to build a house and own a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, body cream, hair grease, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Zainab from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children between aged two and seven years-old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2008, Zainab established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to be self dependent. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting the fish which is very difficult because sometimes vehicles break on the way.  

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Noe Salvador

texts.es: Noé vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, cuando su siembra ya esta lista las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poder llevar el pan diario a su hogar.
texts.en: Noé lives with his life partner and their children in his own house. He grows corn and beans. He has farmed for several years, which has given him the experience to produce great harvests. He sells his harvest in the surrounding community and has many customers who prefer his quality products, affordable prices, and, most of all, good service. He needs to invest and has applied for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, pesticide, weed killer, fertilizer, and more so that he can continue his harvest and support his family.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, pesticide, weed killer, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 38 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia.  She is a widow with three children between 17 and 9, who live at home and are attending school.  She is a high school graduate.  For the past ten years she has been selling oil, rice, pepper, etc. in the local market.   She started this business with money given to her by her mother.   She enjoys her business because the business gives her more money.  She sells six days in a week from 7am to 5 pm, and most of the time she uses a taxi to get her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business.   She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Gibson

texts.en:
Gibson is a married man, aged 37, and is blessed with three children between 16 and 7 years old.  He is a livestock farmer and also sells timber in Kiptoim location and has been in operation for a period of 10 years, earning an income of kes 20,000.

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to add more livestock to his farm and purchase timber for sale.  The profits he earns will be used to purchase more livestock for farming as well as timber to sell.  They will also repay the loan.

His dream is to be successful in his business and also financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and timbers for sale

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer hailing from the village of Bugashe, in the district of Mbarara. He got married at the age of 37 and, at the age of 45, his wife passed away, leaving him with four children. This man struggled to take care of the children alone. This was not easy for him. He then decided to remarry and, together, they had four more children. 

Originally, Charles was a serious banana farmer, but his plantation was completely destroyed by banana wilt disease. He decided to start coffee farming and this has enabled him to raise fees for the children as well as to take care of other needs of the family. 

The wilt disease is now attacking his coffee and he is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy caricides (pesticides) for his coffee plantation and also to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his coffee plantation and to complete his house.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Patience from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside of Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County and has one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options makes Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Patience is single with two children, age 12 and 7. Her children are currently attending school and live at home. 

She runs a table business selling clothes such as blouses, tee-shirts, trousers, etc.  She describes herself as serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago using money given to her by her mother.  Typically, she works 7am to 4pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as small capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase blouses, tee-shirts, trousers, etc. to sell.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, tee-shirts, trousers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 24-years-old and married with three children aged between one-year and six-years-old.  She runs a business in Torkpoi town Bo in Sierra Leone. She began her business at the time when she lost her father and decided to run a business to support her parent.

To earning a living, she sells biscuits, sugar, and sweets from her house. She does not have any source of income expect her business. She says that at present, her problem is insufficient capital to run her business.

Esther requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase pure water, biscuits and sugar to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her children's welfare. In the future, she would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase pure water, biscuits and sugar in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Zoe from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside of Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Zoe is a widow with six children. Four of her children currently attend school and  live at home. 

She runs a shop business selling bread.  She describes herself as serious businesswoman. She started her business three years ago, using money given to her oldest child.  Typically, she works 7am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by means of a shared taxi.  She cites her greatest challenge as small capital.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more bread for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for her business.

loans.name: Fawaz

texts.en:
Fawaz is a 60-year-old married man and the father of six children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1974, and it was his only source of income until two of his children who are under 18 quit school to start working in order to help their father in avoiding the burden of their expenses and living needs.
In addition to their family needs and requests, two of his children are still at school.  One of them is registered in a public school and the other in a private one. Although two of his children didn't have the chance to benefit from it to the maximum, educating his children is very important to him, since he didn't have the chance to finish his education and he only finished his elementary classes.

Fawaz is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to make necessary maintenance to his car and, in addition, to pay for his children's school registration fees for the coming 2013-2014 academic year.

This is his second loan cycle with Al Majmoua with a good standing pay back history. He hopes to stay in good health to keep on providing his family with the necessary needs.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance to his car.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Teresa desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Teresa is very responsible regarding her household obligations and has always sought to offer her family the best. She lives with her husband and their children. She is hardworking and has always done her work happily and enthusiastically. Every year she plants the main local crops, corn and beans. 

Teresa wants to increase sales and came to Integral's office to apply for a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more. She is counting on the help because she has no other income source. This way, she will be able to keep supporting her family without any problem.

loans.use: to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 38 years old and he supports two people in his family. He runs a retail shop and sells newspapers in the Kaptumo trading center in Nandi County served by KADET LLD. The Kapsabet office and this shop have been his income-generating business for the last four years.  He earns an average monthly income of KES 15,000.
 
Peter has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000, with which he intends to pay school fees for his brother. He anticipates getting a profit to expand his business by increasing more items to meet his clients' demand.

Peter hopes to improve his living standards and to be able to meet his financial needs.  He also hopes to save money to enable him to pay school fees for siblings as well as expand his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa with her lovely and nice family lives in the village of Ddmashen in the Sevan area. Larisa is married and she has a large and hospitable family including her husband, mother-in-law, her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. It is already 20 years since Larisa has been engaged in farming. For some time, she worked at the illuminating glass factory, but today the main and the only source of income is her farming. On her farm, she has cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. With the help of her last Kiva loan, Larisa managed to increase the number of sheep and buy a lot of animal fodder. She is a very responsible client of Nor Horizon and she has already taken prior loans.

Larisa wants to have a deal with Kiva lenders again and she is asking for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy piglets since this time she wants to try her luck in swine breeding. She is sure that having such a reliable partner like Kiva, her farm’s prosperity is guaranteed.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 24-year-old single guy and a brother of six siblings. Having a big family brings some financial stress to the parents, especially now that the education fees and living costs have gotten higher. For that reason, Hussein works at distributing newspapers before his school hour starts as he goes to the university to study graphic design. Hussein is applying today for an education loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Зеби женщина средних лет, замужняя, имеет четверых детей.  Живет в Гафуровском районе.  Она более тридцати лет работает на химчистке. Её муж занимается сельскими работами, у него есть земля, занимается рисоводством.   В семье сейчас семь человек, у Зеби два сына и две дочери, старшая дочь вышла замуж, старший сын тоже женат, имеет одного ребенка, работает на стройке.   Младший сын в этом году закончил школу. 
 У Зеби большой дом, и она хочет   отремонтировать его так как очень долгое время не ремонтировали. Дом в плохом состоянии.  Но для этого  нужны денежные средства, а наличность у них мало, так как в мае её муж потратил деньги на посев риса, а урожай будет в октябре.   Поэтому Зеби решила получить  кредит, купить строительные материалы и  отремонтировать дом. Заранее благодарит Арванд за осуществление ее планов.
texts.en:
Zebi is a middle aged woman; she is married and has four children and lives in the Gafurov district. She has worked as a dry-cleaner for over thirty years. Her husband is a farmer; he has land where he grows rice. The family now has seven members: Zebi's two sons and two daughters, the elder daughter's husband, and the wife and child of the eldest son, who works in construction. The younger son is finishing high school this year. 

Zebi has a large house, and she would like to do some repairs, since upkeep hasn't been done in a very long time. The house is in bad condition, but to fix it will require money, and they don't have much extra since in May Zebi's husband spent money on rice planting, and the harvest will be in October. For that reason Zebi decided to request a loan to buy building materials and repair the house. She thanks you in advance for bringing her plans to fruition.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old, married lady. Her husband is a truck driver and they have two children. 

Amal has a tailoring business from which she is helping her husband pay for their living expenses of household bills and the children's needs. 

Amal is now applying for a loan to buy more fabric, threads, and a few fabric accessories. She also wants to do some maintenance to her sewing machine, so it serves her longer.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, threads, and a few fabric accessories and to do some maintenance to her sewing machine.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 36-year-old Salamatu from Torkpoitown  Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married and has two children. Her children go to school.  In 2003, Salamatu established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Salamatu plans to see her business to her higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Cecelia, from Liberia. She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia. The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County, with one of the best standards of living in the country. Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents, and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 

Cecelia is single, with two children, ages 11 and four. Her children are currently attending school and live at home. 

She runs a table business, selling used clothes, such as blouses, tee-shirts, and trousers.  She describes herself as serious businesswoman. 

Cecelia started her business two years ago, using money given to her mother. Typically, she works at her business from 7am to 4pm, Monday to Saturday, and she transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as small capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, Cecelia intends to purchase more used clothes, such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and tee-shirts. 

In the future, Cecelia plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you, in advance, for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell, such as blouses, jeans, trousers, and tee-shirts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is aged 30 years and is a resident of Nsumbi a Kampala City suburb.  He has two children who are both in school.  Joseph studied up to secondary level but could not continue because of a lack of tuition.

Joseph has a retail shop business that he started in 2010 with the aim of improving on his daily income and which is located in a busy trading centre.  

Joseph's major customers are mostly the neighbors and people from different areas. He is assured of market and has all the experience to succeed in this business. However, he faces challenges of competition, inadequate capital and at times changes in the market prices. 

Joseph obtained a loan of ugx.1,000,000/= in order to purchase more stock of the products that are in high demand from his business in order to meet the needs of his customers in the market.

Joseph’s dream is to become a big trader through acquiring more loans as a simple source of income for him.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Fany Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fany del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente del departamento de León rodeado en esta temporada de invierno de montañas florecidas donde prevalece el aroma natural de las flores y de ríos caudalosos donde prevalece el agua cristalina.

En este bello pueblo predomina lo turístico por sus paisajes atractivos.

Fany se siente muy orgullosa de haber nacido en esta maravillosa tierra y fue aquí donde tuvo a su primer y única hija a la cual le inculca lo tradicional de su pueblo y las costumbres pueblerinas.

Se recibió como contadora y desde hace más de veinte años se desempeña como tal en una empresa de la localidad. Con su salario ha mejorado su vivienda y ha tratado de darle a su hija lo mejor que puede en cuanto a educación.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel para que con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva lo financien el cual lo requiere para Compra de medicina, realización de ultrasonidos y pago de consultas médicas con el fin de mejorar su salud ya que se ha sentido mal.

Espera con gran fe que estas personas apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Fany del Carmen lives in the city of El Sauce in the western section of León department. During the winter season, the nearby mountains are covered by naturally scented flowers, and crystal-clear water runs in the rivers. The beautiful landscapes make tourism the main business in this community. Fany is proud to be a native of this marvelous area. She gave birth to her only child, a daughter, here, and she has educated her in the community's traditions and customs. 

Fany received a degree in accounting and has worked in this profession for a local business for 20 years. She has used her salary to renovate her home and to give her daughter the best education she could afford.

She has applied to Ceprodel for a Kiva loan to buy medicine and to pay for an ultrasound and medical appointments so that she can improve her poor health. She has great faith that her loan will be approved so that she can make this investment.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for an ultrasound and medical appointments.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 55-year-old single woman, who is well known in her region because of her experience and excellent business management.  She has been selling wood furniture and souvenirs since 1991.  She also designs and sells special hand-made crafts for occasions such as births, engagements, and weddings.  She is also a tailor, so her shop is very broad, and she splits it into departments; each part is for a certain business, but at the same time, they are in one place but blended in a beautiful and smart way.

Asmahan has been an Al Majmoua borrower for eight cycles, and her business has improved a lot with the help of Al Majmoua loans, which she has invested in adding a certain product to her shop each time.

She is a hardworking woman.  She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with special home products and wooden souvenirs that will attract customers' attention and increase her revenue.

She is still working hard and hoping to open a larger shop in the future with a big showroom for her handmade souvenirs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special home products and wooden souvenirs.

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en:
Tahreer is 24-years-old and from Nablus.  She is married and has one child.

She owns a small farm for raising cattle and selling dairy and cheese in the market.  

She asked Kiva partner Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more cattle for her farm.  Through this loan Tahreer will be able to increase the productivity and thus improve her income.

The one who appears in the picture is Tahreer's husband since she refused to take a picture due to cultural norms.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for her farm

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 35-years-old, married and she supports three members of her family.  She has two children aged eight and four years-old respectively.  She has been doing tailoring for a period of over ten years and has a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is now servicing her third term loan of KES 45,000 from Kiva partner KADET LTD and she intends to use this amount in order to purchase textile materials to make more clothes to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

Priscilla's dream is to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase textiles in order to make clothes.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 28 years old.  He lives with his small family in Gavar, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Aram is married and has two children. His wife is a nurse and she works at the local poli-clinics. Aram has no higher education and he does some building and repairing work. Nevertheless, the main income of their family comes from farming.  Aram is engaged in pig breeding. He has ten pigs, and the profit from meat selling is more than his monthly salary.  Aram sells his farm product in different ways.  Sometimes he sells it right from their house through resellers or he sells it to the local butchers.
Aram hopes very much that through Kiva lenders he can enlarge the number of his farm animals and he asks a loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to buy several pigs.

loans.use: To buy several pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat, age 35, is a married woman and a mother of five. She has successfully built an academy in her home. Previously, she took a loan to purchase furniture for her academy to accommodate more students. Over time, she has attained a good number of students and earns a good amount of profit through her business to meet her household expenses. Currently, she requested a new loan of Rs 25,000 to buy a couple tables and chairs with a new blackboard. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced and wishes to expand her academy in the near future.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a new blackboard.

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий уже несколько раз пользовался кредитами Кива. Благодаря предыдущим кредитам Василий смог расширить ассортимент продукции на новом торговом месте.
В этот раз Василий планирует использовать полученную финансовую помощь в размере 11 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить наручные, настенные и электронные часы под реализацию, тем самым далее расширяя свой бизнес.
texts.en: Vasiliy has already received loans from KIVA several times. Thanks to previous loans Vasiliy was able to expand his inventory at a new market stall. This time Vasiliy plans to use the funds he is requesting, 11,000 Hryvnia, to buy watches, clocks, and digital clocks to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase watches and digital clocks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years of age, widowed, and has two children. She has a food stall business that she has been running for four years in Kitengela town. 

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD, and she plans to buy more stock of food supplies for use in her business. These include milk, sugar, beans, maize, flour and rice. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

She hopes to grow her business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of food supplies.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is age 33. She sells ladies clothes and has been in the business for a half year. She has recently changed from selling vegetables to clothes. With the loan, she wants to buy more shirts and skirts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en: Hala is a 40 year-old hardworking mother of three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver, while she works in her mini-bus sending kids to school and bringing them back home at the end of the day.   Besides using the bus as a school bus for other kids, she wants to use her free time in the afternoon distributing goods to be able to cover her sons' and the family's needs.  She applied for this loan to first do some repairing to the bus and second to start a business and bring some home gadgets and products to sell.

loans.use: to first do some repairing to the bus and bring some home gadgets and products to sell.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 36 year-old mother of six children.   Having a big family makes it difficult for her husband to cover all their needs, so she applied for this loan to start a beauty salon at home and start selling make up and cosmetics products, beauty tools and hair styling tools.

loans.use: to start a beauty salon at home and start selling make up and cosmetics products, beauty tools and hair styling tools.

loans.name: Jameel

texts.en: Jameel is 51 years old and is from Ramallah.  He is married and has one child.  He has owned a small local restaurant selling traditional food like humus and falafel since 2009.  He asked Ryada for this loan in order to develop his restaurant and buy some chairs, tables, and a refrigerator for his local falafel restaurant.  He hopes that this loan will help him increase his customers, and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to develop his restaurant and buy some chairs, tables, and a refrigerator for his local falafel restaurant.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is aged 31. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children's needs. Agnes has been very thankful for the previous loan, which helped her to increase charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Maro

texts.en:
In the region of Gegharkunik, there is a beautiful and sunny village named Ddmashen, and here lives a very kind and lovely woman Maro with her family. Maro is married and she has two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is married and lives separately; her elder son is also married and works with the peacekeeping troops.  Her smallest son has recently been discharged from the army and doesn’t work. Maro’s husband is in the Russian Federation for work abroad (he has a specialty in building) and time to time he manages to support his family financially. 

Maro graduated from Yerevan Cooperative College, and she has a specialty in accounting. She managed to work for several years, but after getting married, she became fully engaged in farming and agriculture. She has a plot of land and a big farm. Maro mainly cultivates potato and grains. On her farm she has four cows, five bulls, one calf, three sheep, four piglets, and twenty chickens. There is a lot of work on their farm, and Maro’s smallest son helps her very much.

It is Maro’s first loan and she needs 800,000 Armenian Drams to buy a cow, a calf, and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf, and animal fodder.

loans.name: Lutfi

texts.en: Lutfi is a 53 year-old father for four sons. He has a mechanic shop that has been in business for the last six years. In his shop, he only changes some of the cars' parts and he now wants to add more cars' parts that were not available in the shop, to expand his business.   He also wants to bring more brake and tire changing tools.

loans.use: to add more car parts and more brake and tire changing tools.

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Raul es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos asi como muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Raul  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Raul is very friendly and hard-working. He lives with his wife and their four children. He works very hard on his own parcel of land where he sows corn and beans. His products are very high in quality. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in sacks as well as taking a picture to then go out and sell it to different markets near his place of residence.

Raul is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have the money necessary to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest control products, fertilizer, compost and seeds, among other things he needs for his harvest. He is anxious to increase his sales in order to be able to earn a better income and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest control products, fertilizers, compost, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack is 27 years old, married, and supports a family of three children between the ages of 4 years and 7 years; his spouse supports him in meeting some of their financial needs. Isaack runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County.  He has been in this business for the last five years, and this business generates an average profit of 10,000 KES a month.

Isaack has borrowed a loan of 100,000 KES with Kadet Ltd, and he intends to use the whole amount of the loan to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport service business. With the anticipated profits, he intends to expand his business by starting a tea farming business to diversify his sources of income, and also to pay school fees for his children.

His hope is that he will be able to repay the loan in time as well as expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 45 year-old man from Kemeloi Junction in Vihiga county, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  He supports seven people in his family and is a married man with five children who are 22, 20, 14, 5 and 2 years old respectively.

He sells and repairs shoes, a business he has been doing for the last 20 years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.   He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more shoe products for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to open another shop for shoes.

His dream is to become a supplier and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah a 30-year-old mother of three children. When her husband goes to work, she starts her home business selling female clothing items. She depends on the word of mouth to be known and keep selling her goods, and now she is starting to have a good number of customers. 

Now Sabah wants to add lingerie and some formal tops to her inventory to sell, and for that she has applied to this youth loan.

loans.use: to start selling lingerie and some formal tops as part of her existing clothing business.

loans.name: Angellea

texts.en:
Angellea is 40 years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the last thirteen years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. She earns a monthly income of about KES 7,350 from the business.

Angellea was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her kiosk, such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions, which she will resell to her customers. She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her child, and to continue expanding the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business, so that she may improve her family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables, which she will resell at her kiosk

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur learned how to run a farm when he was little boy. Now he is a farmer who runs a farm with 25 years of experience.  His farm currently includes 11 cows and 4 bulls. Artur and his wife are devoted parents who take care of four children. Only the income that comes from agricultural activities is spent on covering the family's basic costs, so it is very difficult for Artur to save money to cover the farm's costs.

Artur is asking for this loan in order to pay for forage and be able to feed the livestock. The loan is very important for him to be able to continue the expansion of his farm. Although Artur's farm is not very big, he has great plans and a desire to make it rich and profitable. Artur waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is 35 years old from Gaza. She is married and has five children. She has owned a grocery store since 2009.

Shireen has asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy some goods and a refrigerator for her grocery store. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the products displayed, thus increasing the sales and improving her income.

The one who appears in the picture is Shireen's husband, since she preferred not to appear in the picture herself due to cultural manners.

loans.use: to buy some goods and a refrigerator for her grocery store

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана уже не первый раз ощущает на себе пользу своевременной финансовой помощи, которую она получала от КИВА. У нее увеличилось количество денег в товаре, и доход возрос на 1 000 гривен. 
На сумму в 24 000 гривен она надеется пополнить товар и закупить дополнительную порцию сувенирной продукции, а именно, приобрести сопилки (национальный украинский музыкальный инструмент), рубашки, брелки и магниты. Светлана надеется, что бизнес будет и в дальнейшем развиваться и приносить больше прибыли в семью.
texts.en:
This is not the first time Svetlana has experienced the utility of well-timed financial help from KIVA. She has already increased the amount of capital in inventory, and her income has risen by 1000 hryvnia.

With 24,000 hryvnia she hopes to fill out her inventory and expand her stock of souvenirs: in particular sopilky (a traditional Ukrainian musical instrument), shirts, key chains, and magnets. Svetlana hopes that her business will continue to develop and bring more profits to the family.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs for retail sale

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: Josette is 43 years old. She is a mother of one child aged seven. She sells different items in her canteen. With the loan, she would like to buy more andazi (doughnuts) and fresh milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more andazi and fresh milk for sale.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is 32 years old, married, and supports a family of three children ages between 4 and 7 years. His spouse works in a dispensary and supports him in meeting some of their financial needs. He operates a Motorcycle transport business and a hotel in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. He has been in this business for the last five years and with this business he gets an average profit of KES 140,000 a month.

Sammy has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000 with KADET LTD. With this loan he intends to use the whole amount to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport service business. He anticipates getting profits, which he intends to use to support his family and expand his business. He hopes that after  repaying his loan on time he will consequently meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to expand his transport business.

loans.name: Gesca

texts.en:
Gesca is age 24. She is married with two children ages two and seven. Only one goes to school. 

With the loan she would like to buy more carrots, green beans, and tomatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, green beans, and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: This is Epiphanie, aged 31. She is married and has three children; all of them go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more sodas and beers for resale. With the profits from the business, she will buy a house, one day.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for resale.

loans.name: Tuku

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Tuku from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents, and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live.
 
Tuku is married with three children, between 18 and 8. Her children are currently attending school and live at home.

She runs a table business selling fish.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business two years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  She typically works at her business from 7am to 4pm, Monday through Saturday, and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites small capital as her greatest challenge.  She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase fish for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is an ambitious 39-year-old woman. She is the mother of four daughters and one son. Wejdan made all the decoration pieces at her home. Whenever she has guests coming over they ask her about them. They told her she should do it as a business and order a piece or two.

At first she did it only when people asked her to, but now Wejdan is seeking to make more handmade pieces that will allow her to participate in local bazaars. So, she applied for a loan to buy more straw, glue, and some decorative flowers to make more trays, mirror frames, and other items.

loans.use: to buy more straw, glue, and some decorative flowers to make more trays and mirror frames.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru:
Зульфинисо счастливая мать двух прекрасных детей. Она разведена, к сожалению несколько лет тому назад муж развелся с ней оставив ее одну с двумя детьми.  Зульфинисо было очень трудно одной растить и воспитывать своих детей но она старалась делать все чтобы стать для них и отцом и матерью, чтобы дети не чувствовали  отсутствие отца.  Зульфинисо конечно же сама чувствует себя одинокой и брошенной но старается этого не показывать своим детям. Ее дети очень заботливые и помогают своей матери.  Зульфинисо работает в одном из ресторанов своего города. Она повар, и готовить очень вкусные и не обычные блюда. Зульфинисо очень ответственный и хороший работник,ее очень все любят и ценят как профессионального и хорошего повара. Ее работа ей очень нравиться и за три года работы она достигла очень многого.  
На данный момент Зульфинисо  планирует отремонтировать свой дом так как давно не ремонтировала. Ее дом в очень плохом состоянии и нуждается в обновлении. С этой целю Зульфинисо обратилась в организацию Арванд чтобы получить кредит и купить строительные материалы.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso is a happy mother to two wonderful children. She is divorced - unfortunately, several years ago, her husband divorced her and left her alone with two children.  It was very difficult for Zulfiniso to raise her children by herself, but she tried to do everything to become both their father and their mother, so that her children would not feel the absence of a father.  Of course, Zulfiniso herself feels lonely and abandoned, but she tries not to let her children know this.  Her children are very caring and help their mother.  Zulfiniso works in one of the restaurants in her town. She is a cook, and prepares very delicious and exceptional dishes. Zulfiniso is a very responsible and good worker, and she is loved and valued as a good and professional chef. She likes her job very much and she has achieved a lot in three years.  Now, Zulfiniso plans to repair her house, because it has been a long time since it was repaired.
Her home is in very poor condition, and is in need of renovation. With this goal, Zulfiniso has turned to Avrand in order to receive a loan to purchase building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 39-year-old, conservative woman. She asked her husband, who helps her in the business, to appear in the photo in her place.

Samar and her husband have four children to support. During the past seven years, Samar built a poultry house and has been selling some of the chickens' eggs and chickens. Now, Samar is applying for a loan, which she will use to build another poultry house and obtain more chickens.

loans.use: to build another poultry house and obtain more chickens

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru:
Эдуард живет в Виноградово. Он занимается ремонтом ювелирных изделий. Работает на себя, без помощников вот уже 2.5 года. Эдуард не женат, живет с матерью. Очень любит свою работу. Этим бизнесом занимался отец Эдуарда, но год тому назад он умер. И Эдуард решил продолжить дело отца. В основном Эдуард занимается ремонтом золотых и серебряных изделий.
Эдуарду необходима сумма в 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в своем рабочем кабинете, а также приобрести материалы и нужное оборудование, а именно микроскопы, паяльник и т.п. Со временем Эдуард планирует открыть еще одну точку по ремонту ювелирных изделий.
texts.en: Eduard lives in Vinogradovo. He works for himself, doing jewelry repair, as he has for two and a half years. He is not married, and lives with his mother. He loves his work. Eduard's father was in this business, but he passed away a year ago, and Eduard has decided to carry on his work. For the most part Eduard works with gold and silver jewelry. He needs 24,000 hryvnia to remodel his workshop and buy materials and equipment, specifically microscopes, a soldering iron, etc. Eduard plans to eventually open an additional shop.

loans.use: to remodel his workshop and purchase equipment

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa is a 20-year-old single guy who is attending the university to study and get his bachelor degree in Marketing. Mustafa is the youngest brother of three siblings. He is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 50 years old and has five children. She has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru and has applied for her sixth loan from KADET LTD. to enable her buy stock of items such as sugar, rice, flour, and soap, among others.

Having paid her previous loan successfully, Jecinta's anticipated profit will be used to buy more stock for her business. 

She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of items such as sugar, flour, soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is 29 years old and single; he does not support anyone. He runs a retail shop in Kapkangani trading centre, in Kapsabet, Kenya. This has been his income-generating business for the past four years. He earns an average monthly income of KES 15,000.
 
He has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000. He intends to use the loan to purchase stock for his retail shop, including a 50 kg bag of sugar, cooking oil, six bundles of maize flour, and a bundle of wheat flour. He anticipates getting profits, which he intends use to expand his business further, by increasing more inventory items to meet his customers' demand.

Felix hopes to improve his living standard and to be able to meet his financial needs. He also hopes to save money to enable him to build himself a house and help his parents to pay school fees for his siblings. In addition, he would like to expand his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase stock for his grocery store

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 51-year-old man, married with three children aged 22, 16, and 16, and they are all school-going. He deals in piggery and poultry. He began his business in 2003. 

His purpose for starting his business was to start his home income to meet his family's needs and pay tuition for his children. His customers are chicken traders. 

His dream is to be able to have a big poultry farm, so that he can win tenders (contracts) to supply hotels in the city. His challenge is lack of enough markets to sell his chicken. His customers testify that he is hard working and has good customer service.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and also restock chicks.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом замужняя женщина, имеет троих детей. Она занимается торговлей овощами и фруктами.  У неё возле дома есть маленькая лавка, где она продает овощи и фрукты.    Этим видом деятельности занимается уже несколько лет. Муж тоже работает. Гуландом очень старательная женщина, ради своих детей она готова работать без выходных, с утра она ездит на рынок, покупает свежие фрукты и овощи, продает до самого вечера. Раньше ей помогала дочь, но она вышла замуж, муж иногда помогает ей после работы.   Не давно её сын заболел и на его лечение и медикаменты требуется определенная сумма денег, поэтому они с мужем решили получить кредит.  А также они хотят немного освежить свой дом.  Поэтому часть кредита хотят потратить на лечение сына, а на оставшуюся сумму купить строительные материалы и отремонтировать квартиру, так как давно не ремонтировали. Гуландом заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulandom is a married woman who has three children. She is a vendor who sells vegetables and fruits. She has a small stall near her home where she sells vegetables and fruits.  She has engaged in this trade for several years now. Her husband also works. Gulandom is a very diligent woman, who is prepared to work seven days a week for her children.  In the morning, she goes to the market, purchases fresh fruits and vegetables, and sells them until evening.  Earlier, her daughter used to help her, but she got married and her husband sometimes helps after work. Recently, her son became ill, and his treatment and medication require a certain amount of money.  Therefore, she and her husband have decided to take out a loan.  They also want to remodel their home a little.  Because of this, they want to spend a portion of the loan on their son's treatment, and use the rest to purchase building materials in order to repair their apartment, because it has been a long time since they have repaired it. Gulandom thanks Avrand in advance for the support.

loans.use: pay for medical treatment for her son and purchase building materials

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила торгует женской одеждой. В основной ассортимент ее товара входят костюмы для женщин, платья, юбки и блузки. Этим бизнесом она занимается уже 7 лет. Торговая точка расположена очень выгодно, есть свои постоянные клиенты. 
Сумму в 24 000 гривен она планирует вложить в закупку новых моделей летней сезонной одежды, а именно, сарафанов, блузок и платьев для полных женщин. Дополнительная финансовая помощь поможет Людмиле обновить модный ассортимент. Товар она уже предварительно заказала на оптовой базе, где он ожидает отгрузки, осталось только оплатить его.
texts.en:
Ludmila sells women's clothing. Her products primarily include suits for women, dresses, skirts and blouses. She has been in this business for over seven years. Her retail outlet has a good location and she has her own loyal customers.

She plans to invest 24,000 UAH to purchase new models of seasonal summer clothing, specifically, sundresses, blouses and plus-sized dresses. The additional financial support would help Ludmila upgrade her merchandise to contemporary fashions. She has already pre-ordered the merchandise at the distribution center, where it is ready to be picked up as soon as she provides payment.

loans.use: to purchase summer merchandise

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old, married, and supports a family of six people. She runs a cereals business in the Kapsaos trading centre in Nandi County, and she is served by KADET LTD. The Kapsabet office and this have been her income generating business for the last five years, and she earns an average monthly income of KES 19,000.
