He plans to use the loan amount to buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm. Due to climatic conditions and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers.

Jackson hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. His dream is to venture into large-scale farming and have his own farm machinery. Jackson is very determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 40 years old and married with three children. She is a responsible and hardworking woman. Estelita's spouse is a farmer and hog raiser within their local community. She is grateful because during the previous crop season, she was able to produce a better rice crop. 

With regards to her aim to have a continuously smooth flow of her rice crop production, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), allowing her to buy necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides. She knows that through proper application of the necessary farm inputs to her rice farmland, she can further obtain greater yields and income and be able to educate her two children who currently go to school.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides for development of her rice farming business.

loans.name: Maria Montesori

texts.es:
En la cálida ciudad de Pucallpa vive Maria, una mujer de 38 años madre de 1 pequeño de 9 años a quien ama mucho y sobre todo porque Maria lucha cada día para poder sacarlo adelante.  Con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de educación, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de administración.

Cada día desde muy temprano Maria sale a trabajar como empleada en una pequeña empresa distribuidora de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y  también tiene un pequeño negocio de maderería y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo tiene la mejor motivación del mundo, la cual es su hijo.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar madera para su negocio  ya que tiene varios pedidos de clientes , lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
María, 38, lives in the warm city of Pucallpa.  She's the mother of nine-year-old child whom she loves very much and for whom she strives every day so he can get ahead.  With a lot of effort she managed to study education, but she very much would like to have studied business administration.

Every day María goes out very early to work as an employee in a small distributor business in her city.  She works around nine hours a day and also has a small lumber business.  With the fruit of her work she's able to pay for her household expenses.  She believes she's getting ahead because she's very responsible and she has the greatest motivation in the world--her son.

María's very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she'll be able to buy wood for her business, because she has several customer orders.

This will allow her to improve her income and continue striving to make her biggest dream a reality: "To give her son a profession."

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
At the age of 26, Abida is an energetic woman. She has been running a flower-making business for three years. It’s been a passion of hers: she knows the method of making beautiful flowers from fabric, paper and other materials. She also arranges handmade wedding garlands for brides and grooms, and flowers out every material she finds suitable. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs.

She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase raw materials, including different types of fabrics, such as silk, tissue and cotton, along with some packs of glue and wire. With the purchase of these materials, she will be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales. Abida is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including different types of fabrics, such as silk, tissue and cotton, along with some packs of glue and wire.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 58 years old, married and has four children.

Romana is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Romana requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Romana has been in hog raising for 13 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Romana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anching

texts.en:
Anching is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She dreams of a better future for her family, and this inspires her to manage a general store business. Her income from selling different grocery items helps a lot in providing for the growing needs of her family. 

Anching started managing her store several years ago. She wants to earn income for their future emergencies. To have more business growth, she is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase more grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread and beverages to sell. She will use the loan as additional capital to improve and expand her retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 22-year-old married woman and mother of one. She is shown in the photo with her husband who is a driver by profession, providing transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Sobia has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase new tires and to replace an auto rickshaw body part. Sobia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and to replace an auto rickshaw body part.

loans.name: Salaama

texts.en: Salaama is 28 years old. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married and charged with a responsibility of taking care of one child. She operates a retail shop, whereby she sells general merchandise. With the proceeds, she has been able to reinvest in the business and support her family in providing their basic needs. Her dream is to educate her child up to the university while her business plan is to own a wholesale shop. Salaama intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
Mayra es una joven estudiante de 23 años, además de estar estudiando se encuentra trabajando como Recepcionista en un consultorio Odontológico hace más de un año.
Tiene  un hermano menor que se encuentra aun en la primaria, otro también estudiante universitario que se encuentra trabajando en un estudio contable. Su padre aun trabaja y su madre es ama de casa
Mayra se graduara en un periodo de 3 años en la carrera de kinesiología, una carrera que le encanta, ya que puede ayudar a las personas. Espera graduarse para acceder a un trabajo con mejor salario y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella en el futuro anhela poder ser una excelente profesional y establecerse con su propio consultorio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y seguir cubriendo así sus gastos de estudio.
texts.en:
Mayra, 23, is a young student.  In addition to attending school she also has been working for more than a year as a receptionist in a dental office.  She has a younger brother who's still in elementary school; another one is also a college student who works in an accounting office.  Her father still works and her mother's a housewife.

Mayra will graduate from the kinesiology program in three years.  She loves the career because she can help people.  She hopes to graduate and get a job with a better salary so she can improve her quality of life.  In the future she hopes to be an excellent professional and set up her own office.

She's requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and continue covering her school expenses.

loans.use: to pay her university fees and expenses

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 51 years old and married with eight children. With four children currently in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, soft drinks and other groceries in her general store.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer is a 46-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop while also earning additional income from her rental houses. With what little earnings she has, she educated her children and started on building her residential house. She dreams of completing her house, although she lacks enough capital. Jeniffer is requesting a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman running a small general store in her community with the support of her son. She is a mother of four children; one of her sons is shown in the photo. After being let out from school her son also runs the shop. They offer a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store.

Naseem makes enough to provide for her family. However, to fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy packs of salt, rice, sugar, flour, biscuits and beverages from the market at lower rates. This will enable her to consistently meet increasing demand. Naseem wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, rice, sugar, flour, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: At the age of 32, Sakina is an energetic married woman. She has been running a flower manufacturing business for many years; it’s been a passion of hers. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies the local market. Sakina's immense experience in the art of flower-making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and, for the improvement of her business, she requires a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue paper. Sakina is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of loan investment.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including wires, cutters, floral tape, scissors, beads, paints and tissue paper.

loans.name: Basudev Group

texts.en:
Dakuluguda is a remote tribal village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Most of the inhabitants of this village are tribal. In the year 2010, six active women entrepreneurs in this village formed a group named Basudev to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing businesses. Mamata is one of them. The lady standing third from right, touching the flour-milling machine, is Mamata. She is an energetic lady of 30 years who lives with her husband, one son who is nine years old and one daughter who is 13 years old. Both her children are continuing their primary education in the village school. 

Mamata has been running a wheat flour milling business in her village with a single machine for the last five years. Her husband is helping her in this business. She earns a daily net income of 400 INR from the existing businesses. Out of this income, she has been able to manage her household expenses in a decent manner. So Mamata is planning to increase her income by expanding the business. Looking into the demand of the locality, with the present loan, Mamata wants to put another two units of machine in her center. One is for processing flattened rice and another is for wheat flour. She is convinced that this will generate a handsome income for her. Mamata hopes to save enough money to provide a better education for her children and construct another hall for the new machines.

The other five members of the group are Sabutri and Sushila who have a general store business, Laxmi who has a Tiffin center with a fast food center, Gayatree who has a tailoring center and Pausa who has a barber shop businesses, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase machinery for flattened rice and wheat flour milling.

loans.name: Robila

texts.en: Robila is a 26-year-old married woman. She is efficiently running an ice cream cart with the support of her husband. Both are working together happily to support their family. Robila is expert in making ice cream at home while her husband assists her by selling it door-to-door in their community. Robila is a mother of one child; she needs to cover the educational expenses along with other expenses. For the expansion of her business she is planning to buy another cart to start the sales from their home as well. Robila contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy another ice cream cart.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for many years. She started this line of work at a very young age. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her community. Her customers’ demand is increasing day by day but due to lack of capital she is unable to meet those demands. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. She is hopeful of increasing her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to provide them a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Maa Annapurna Group

texts.en: “MAA ANNAPURNA”, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2009 by four active women from Khariar town of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Sandhyarani is one of the members of this group, standing second from the left with her hand raised. She is 31 years of age and lives in a rented house with her husband and two sons who are nine and seven years old. Ten years ago, Sandhyarani’s husband migrated to this place from the coastal belt and worked in a barber shop as a daily wage earner for three years. In the year 2007, Sandhyarani started a one-seat barber shop of her own in a low profile with the help of her husband. In the subsequent years, with three consecutive loans from Mahashakti Foundation, she developed her shop into three seats by taking a rented cabin in the heart of the town. She has engaged two male workers for giving service to the customers. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her barber shop, which is not at all sufficient to manage the household expenses, the education expenses of her children and the regular expenses for the business. As she is an outsider to this place, she doesn’t have her own house to live. Therefore, Sandhyarani want to increase her income by adding some extra facility to the existing business for generating the minimum necessities of her family. This is the fourth loan of Sandhyarani and she wants to purchase a facial machine, a massage machine and two big mirrors. She also wants to repair the existing moving chairs. From this investment, she expects a good return for the total development of her family. With the extra income, Sandhyarani hopes to purchase a plot of land and construct a house for her family. She also dreams of giving a better education to her children. The other three members of this group are Janaki, Pusbabai and Satyabhama who are running a betel nut shop with a tailoring center, vending vegetables and running a tea stall with biscuits and snacks, respectively.

loans.use: To purchase a facial machine, massage machine and two big mirrors

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 39-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop business since 2011 and also earns a salary as a civil servant to boost his income. He hopes to educate his children to the university level. He wants to grow his business to a wholesale shop despite challenges of theft and customers who fail to pay on time. Fred is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline and her husband are managing their rice farming business. They share ideas in growing their rice crops to have a productive outcome. They keep on working hard to support the education of their children.   

They are times when Evangeline cannot provide for all their farming needs due to lack of funds which sometimes has some effect on their crops. In line with this, she is now asking for financial assistance of lenders for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizer, herbicides and to pay the labor costs on their farm.  Evangeline is hoping that by providing for the needs of the farm, she can have a better yield and get a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 33-year-old married man with two children living in Masindi, Uganda. For five years, he has been in the decoration business as well as earning a salary as a civil servant to boost his income. He dreams of buying a plot of land and building a house for his family despite inadequate funds. Alex intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his kitchen in the new restaurant, lease a new property, and retain three jobs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo  es de la ciudad de san Lorenzo, vive con sus padres es hijo único, su madre es docente y su padre es empleado de una empresa. Su meta futura es trabajar como administrador en una empresa y tener ingresos para poder mantenerse y ayudar a su familia. Es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, para poder estar a un paso de su sueño.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, para que así pueda aligerar a su familia. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo
texts.en:
Pablo is from the city of San Lorenzo.  He lives with his parents and is an only child.  His mother's a teacher and his father's employed by a company.

His future goal is to work as the administrator of a company and have income to support himself and help his family.  This is why he's studying business administration, to be able to be a step away from his dream.

He's requesting this loan to be able to pay his university fees so he can relieve the pressure on his family.

He's grateful for the help he's receiving.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 37-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in a retail business for five years and with the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to educate her children to higher levels of learning and to grow her business into a wholesale shop. However, bad debts and lack of enough capital are big challenges. Edina will use the loan to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Originally from Nigeria, Henry moved to Houston and began his mail assistance business, Elnegy, LLC.   He operates the business with the help of one full-time and one part-time employee.  It has been open for four years and is an authorized shipper for the United States Postal Service, DHL, and FedEx and offers dozens of different services. 

With more than 50 box sizes on hand, Elnegy takes care of every shape and size package for foreign and domestic shipping.  Henry offers overnight, two- or three-day delivery, ground shipping, and first class, express, international, certified, bulk and priority mail services.  Elengy also provides stamps.

Henry, however, doesn’t restrict his services to simply shipping.  He offers printing, too.  Whether a customer needs black and white or color, letter, legal or ledger size, binding, laminating or collating, digital or self-service - or even blueprints - Henry can help his customers in every way.

A detailed listing of all of his services is on his website: www.elnegybusiness.com/.  And though he uses the site as a primary form of advertising, Henry knew he needed to diversify his marketing.  After he learned of Accion Texas Inc. from one of his customers, Henry decided to venture to the microlender for a loan. 

The 42-year-old says he plans to expand his business by adding two employees in the future, but is taking needed steps to grow Elnegy.  He is using his Accion loan to fund further marketing and advertising.  He also says with Accion’s loan, he will be able to increase revenues and sustain jobs.

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising

loans.name: Sonia Yaneth

texts.es: Sonia Yaneth es una mujer de 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene un bebé de 9 meses. Siempre ha vivido en el campo y por herencia familiar se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas y en compañía de su esposo tienen vacas productoras de leche, ellos venden sus animales y con ello obtienen los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora y lucha día a día para salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más vacas lecheras para aumentar la producción del líquido y poder incrementar sus ventas, lo que le generaría mayores ingresos económicos. Su principal sueño es aumentar su ganado y la cría de pollos para aumentar sus ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia Yaneth is a 29 year old woman. She is married and has a 9 month-old baby. She has always lived in the countryside and by family tradition she raises chickens with her husband and they also have dairy cows. They sell their animals to earn income to sustain their household. She is an entrepreneurial and hardworking woman. She works hard every day to get ahead. With the loan she is requesting from the Corporation, she wants to buy more dairy cows to increase milk production and increase her sales. This would generate a greater income. Her dream is to grow her herd and the number of chickens in order to increase her income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng is 54 years old. He is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Three of his children are employed as construction workers and a garment worker. They earn about $12 per day. 

Eng has been running a motor taxi service for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily.  Because the present motorbike is old, he is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase will help him attract more customers and earn more income for the family. In the future, he would like to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to run the taxi service

loans.name: Nforneh Pauline

texts.en:
The borrower is married with two children. They live in a two-bedroom apartment house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, including sickness in her family, inadequate finances to manage her business, the sudden death of her child, and constant theft of her business items.

With this new loan, she plans to expand her foodstuff business by buying food items like palm oil, cocoyam (taro), beans, rice, groundnut, salt, groundnut oil, plantains and drinks. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been in the business for a long time, she has experience in the business, she has regular customers who buy from her, and her business is situated at a strategic point for marketing.  With the profit from this loan, she will engage in poultry farming, provide for her granddaughter's education, and take care of other necessities in the family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy drinks and food items like palm oil, cocoyam, beans, rice, groundnut and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel es un grupo de mujeres entusiastas que han decidido, además de ser amas de casa, ser un aporte importante al hogar. Las integrantes de San Miguel se sienten realizadas al emprender negocios manejados por ellas mismas.
Una de ellas, Dora Celia emprendió el negocio de comidas rápidas, vende hamburguesas y hot-dogs. Ella es vecina del municipio de Guadalupe y es reconocida por su rico sazón. Dora Celia se vio apoyada por su esposo para emprender este deseo de superación.
Ella está segura que el compromiso crediticio que ahora asume le permitirá invertir en el mantenimiento del establecimiento donde actualmente vende.
Dora Celia confía en que su negocio va hacia adelante.
texts.en:
San Miguel is a group of enthusiastic women who, in addition to being homemakers, have decided to become important contributors to their households. The members of San Miguel feel fulfilled when starting up businesses run by themselves. 

One of the members, Dora Celia, started a fast-food business selling hamburgers and hotdogs. She is a resident of the municipality of Guadalupe and is known for her delicious sazón (seasoning). Dora Celia’s husband supported her to undertake this desire for self-improvement.

She is sure that the loan commitment she now accepts will allow her to invest in the upkeep of the establishment where she currently sells. Dora Celia is confident that her business is moving forward.

loans.use: to maintain her shop.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es: Abril es un grupo solidario que tiene 3 ciclos con su crédito, sus integrantes son mujeres trabajadoras y cumplidas con sus pagos. Blanca es una de ellas, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos; se dedica a la venta de jugos naturales y snak en casa, comenzó hace 3 años aproximadamente y el crédito la ayudará para meter la venta de elotes y obtener mas ganancia. Actualmente esta acondicionando el porche de su casa para tener mas espacio en su negocio, su esposo también la apoya con la venta y durante el día se turnan para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Abril is a solidarity group which has received three loans to date. The members are hard-working women and reliable with their payments.

Blanca is one of the members; she is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She began selling fresh juice and snacks from her home three years ago, and this loan will help her to also start selling corn on the cob and increase profits. Blanca is currently remodeling the porch of her house to have more space for her business. Her husband helps her with the sales and during the day, they take turns looking after customers.

loans.use: to purchase corn on the cob to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene 32 años es originario de  Nuevo Laredo, es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad quienes están estudiando dos están en la secundaria y dos en la primaria, desea darles lo mejor y que tengan el estudio necesario para que sean unos triunfadores en su futuro.
Desde hace 06 años sea dedicado a la elaboración y venta de alimentas, tiene su propio negocio el cual ella atiende, esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de inmobiliario como es una plancha de cocina mas grade y herramientas para cocinar mas modernas, para preparar mas rápido y mejor sus platillos.
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de comida es para pagar el crédito ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene pasa salir adelante.
Desea mejorar la calidad de servicio y atender mejor a sus cliente con esta inversión esta segura que lo logara, como también pronto podrá ayudar a otras mujeres en darles trabajo en su restauran.
texts.en:
Adriana, 32, is from Nuevo Laredo; she’s a single mother of four children who are in her care and attending school.  Two of them are in secondary school and two are in primary school.  She wants to provide the best for them and that they have the necessary schooling so that they will be successful in the future.

She’s worked for the last six years preparing food.  She has her own business that she tends to herself.  She’s asking for a loan to invest in equipment and furnishings like a larger kitchen grill and more modern kitchen tools to prepare her dishes better and more quickly.

With part of the profits she gets from her food business she will repay the loan since it’s her only source of income to get ahead.  She wants to improve the quality of service and tend to her customers better and with this investment she’s sure to do so; she will also soon be able to help other women by providing them with jobs in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Abundancia Group

texts.es: Abundancia es un grupo responsable y cumplido que tiene 3 ciclos con su crédito. Teresa es una de sus integrantes, una mujer joven de 25 años, casada y con 2 hijas de 5 y 1 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda y el crédito le  ayudará a hacer que crezca invirtiendo en mercancía. Teresa es una mujer que desea salir adelante junto con su familia, ya que quiere darle un buen estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Abundancia is a responsible and accomplished group that has had 3 loans. Teresa is one of its members. She is a young, 25-year-old woman and is married with two daughters, ages 5 and 1. She sells groceries for a living. She has a store and the loan will help her grow her business by investing in merchandise. 

Teresa is a woman who wants to get ahead with her family because she wants to give her daughters a good education.

loans.use: to stock goods and groceries

loans.name: Ma Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Ma del Rosario es ama de casa, es muy trabajadora y tiene un negocio de abarrotes desde hace más de 22 años, con lo cual apoya a su esposo y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos. La Sra. Ma del Rosario trabaja duro en su tienda y la mantiene a flote para que se pueda mantener más años en el gusto del cliente y así poder obtener mas ingresos para su familia. Es por eso que necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder comprar mas mercancia para su negocio ya que quiere satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en: María del Rosario’s a housewife.  She’s very hardworking and has had a grocery store for more than 22 years with which she helps her husband to support their children together.  María del Rosario works hard in her store and keeps it afloat so that she can continue to be her customers’ favorite for many years to come and to earn more income for her family.  It’s because of this that she needs Kiva help to buy more merchandise for her store because she wants to meet all her customers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is 23 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro plants that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Faleupolu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, taro plants, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, gloves and a rake. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Faleupolu will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, taro plants, a wheelbarrow, bush knives, gloves and a rake.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The borrower is a single mother of two children, one of whom is below the age of fifteen. She lives in a two-room apartment in Bamenda in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced some difficulties in life, including sickness and the loss of family members such as her father and mother. Poverty in the general family has also been a problem, and starting up a business was not possible.

She plans to buy two-week-old fowls, as well as feed and the necessary vaccine for the fowls. Part of the loan will be invested in buying provision items such as tinned tomatoes, Maggi, oil, and rice. She believes that her business will succeed because she has been selling and keeping fowls for a long time. The high demand for fowls and manure in the community is another reason for the success of her business. The community will benefit from the supply of fowls, and the manure will also be sold to the public. They will not have to go a long distance to buy provision items. 

The profits will help her improve the housing conditions of the family and provide better education and health for her and her only child. She will also expand her business. She prefers GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy fowls, feed, vaccine, and provision items.

loans.name: Byambadonid

texts.en: Byambadonid, 22 years old, lives with his mother, two brothers, and uncle in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Byambadonid began working as an electrician right after graduating from college. His brother works as a waiter at a restaurant and his mother currently stays at home looking after his youngest brother. Before his full-time job, Byambadonid had been working with his mother by renting a small workshop near their home and providing computer repair services to local people. Now, he is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to open a grocery store as an additional income source. The loan will be used to pay for rent, working capital, and building materials. In addition to purchasing food products in large quantities, he will rent a building appropriate for running a grocery store and will renovate it with bricks and cement.  As a result, he will be able to generate more income for his family and improve their standard of living. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to run a grocery store

loans.name: Nyambayar

texts.en:
Mr. Nyambayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The couple rents an apartment where he, together with his wife, runs a computer spare parts sales business. They have run their business since 2011 and a lot of people have come to recognize their high quality service. Before this business, he used to work as a loan officer at a bank. 

Nyambayar has recently purchased land in another city and wants to build a fence surrounding his land. He is requesting a loan of 2000000 MNT to purchase planks, nails, and an available gate. In the future, he is willing to build his own house on his land. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is improving his life with each passing day.

loans.use: to build a fence surrounding his land.

loans.name: Santos Victoriano

texts.es: Don Santos, es una persona responsable, habita en el Ayote, es soltero no tiene hijos vive con su mama. Se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos de manera ambulante los que hace su mama y él los vende, es su único medio de ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Solicita el crédito para comprar granos básicos, verduras, azúcar, frutas entre otros ingredientes y darle mejor presentación a su carretón que es la unidad de trabajo, el tiene establecida su clientela y su mayor propósito es hacer crecer su pequeño negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir apoyando a su madre.
texts.en:
Don Santos is a responsible person living in El Ayote. He is single, with no children, and lives with his mother. He sells the food and drinks that he and his mother make as a street vendor. It is their only means of income to cover their household expenses.

He is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, vegetables, sugar, fruit and other ingredients, and to improve the look of his cart which is work vehicle. He has an established customer base, and his main goal is to grow his small business to improve his quality of life and continue to support his mother.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sugar, fruit and other items

loans.name: Leidis Mariela

texts.es: La joven Leidis,es soltera ahora trabaja como asistente de carta de venta y fierro en la municipalidad, labor con la que intenta salir adelante, aspira culminar sus estudios universitarios y mejorar sus condiciones de vida junto a su familia. Solicita su 3er crédito para ser invertido en mejoras de su vivienda y así poder comprar primeramente los materiales de construcción y después empezar la obra,                                                        para poder tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Leidis is a young single woman. She now works for the municipality as an assistant that handles paperwork relating to livestock sales and registry of brands, a job that she hopes will help her get ahead. She aspires to complete her university studies and to improve her living conditions with her family. 

She is applying for her third loan, which will be used for improvements to her home. Initially, she will buy building materials and then start construction, so she can have decent housing.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, sand, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Qorichuspa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Marina ella es soltera y tiene 37 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos,uvas,cebollas,zanahorias y pepinos.
El socio que esta tapado con un circulo su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Qorichuspa.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cerámicas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Qorichuspa communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

One member is Marina. She is single, 37 years old, and has two children. She works in her business, selling vegetables and fruits. She sells apples, oranges, grapes, plantains, and mandarins. She also sells carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers. She has a stall in the market where she sells the fruits and vegetables. She works from 8 am to 5 pm. She already has seven years' experience in this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her fruits and vegetables.

The borrower is requesting the loan to purchase oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

The borrower with his face blurred out is no longer a member of this communal bank. The borrowers that are in the inset photo had their picture taken after the group photo because they asked permission to be absent on the day of the group photo due to work reasons. The other communal bank members sell ceramics, have a clothing business, run a grocery store, and sell meals.

The group members are grateful to those who will be part of their dream through this platform, and they promise to make their payments on time and in the agreed-upon manner.

loans.use: purchase oranges, plantains, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman with 2 children, ages 4 and 7. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a drinks store and has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more drinks to sell. Her business goal is to own multiple businesses within 5 years. This is the client's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sailus

texts.en: Sailus is a single man. He operates a second hand clothes business where he sells second hand clothes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area that has potential. He describes his biggest business challenge as city council harassment. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more bales of clothes. His business goal is to be an importer of second hand clothes within 5 years. He also hopes that in the future, he will become an importer of new clothes.

loans.use: buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut would like to take another loan to buy new furniture and repair her stall, in order to provide better quality service to her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that this loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and repair her stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 7 and 11 years. He describes himself to be open minded and determined. He operates a retail shop where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenges to be changes in fashion and inadequate finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase stock of shoes for resale. His business goal is to be self-reliant and have a fixed premise within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his business will excel. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: to increase stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a rental house business where she rents houses to customers. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are tenants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to renovate her rental houses. Her business goal is to build more houses within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Nuestra Señora Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana  ella es conviviente  tiene 33 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gallinas para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de carne, venta de cuyes, venta de anticuchos, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes, servicio de taxi.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These businesses belong to the “NUESTRA SEÑORA DEL CARMEN” communal bank. It is located in the district of San Jerónimo, belonging to the province and department of Cuzco. 

This member is named Juana. She is in a common law marriage and is 33 years old with 3 children. She alternates her other activities with raising small animals such as chickens. She raises them to sell to the customers that order them from her. She has had this business for years and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She wants to keep working so that she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens for her business. The other members work in their businesses selling meat, guinea pigs, anticuchos, vegetables, groceries,  and providing a taxi service. She is grateful to the people who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El socio Teofilo se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su carro.

El socio esta feliz con el credito ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teofilo works in the transportation business. He services a taxi in the different streets in the city of Cusco. The member works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. The member has been working in this business for 8 years and he does very well.  His dream is to have a new car. The member is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his car.

The member is happy with the loan and he promises to pay the quotas.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his car

loans.name: Lich

texts.en: Lich is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a large quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling. Lich's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of garlic to increase her production for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her stall and buy more artwork.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kale, onions, cabbage, and oranges.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael, a public service driver, lives in Mombasa Kenya. He is married and blessed with three school-going children. He knew Milango through his friends. He plans to start motorcycle transport and that’s why he seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings as additional capital for this new venture. He has an ambition of owning a vehicle in five years. The extra income that he gets will help him better his living standards and those of his family. He says that people need to be informed about business opportunities that are available for them to seize them.

loans.use: To buy a motorcylce

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married and she is also a mother. She has been blessed with three school-going children. Aisha and her family live in Kongowea, Kenya. For the last four years, she has been operating a retail shop. She sells commodities such as maize flour, wheat flour, exercise books, and soft drinks. Aisha, who is thirty-five years old, learnt of Milango from a friend and decided to join. She now seeks a loan to buy a sack of rice, bundles of maize flour and a sack of sugar. She is also employed and earns a small salary. She has employed someone to run the shop on her behalf. The only challenge that Aisha faces is bad debts. The loan will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, bundles of maize flour and a sack of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 200 broilers and 10 sacks of poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Operating a retail shop has been the business of 48-year-old Fred for the past ten years. The father of four school-going children knew Milango through friends. He seeks a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy flour, rice and cooking oil as additional stock for his business. The challenge for his business is the competition from other businesses. He sees himself owning a wholesale shop in five years. He will pay school fees for his children from the income that he raises from the use of the loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ten goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add another milk cow to the existing herd

loans.name: Shoroq

texts.en: Shoroq is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. Shoroq is a 29-year-old married woman from Qalqilia. She lives in a small home with her husband and two kids, a boy and a girl. Shoroq's husband is a worker in another city. Because his ability to go to work every day is inhibited by the checkpoint between his city and where he works, his income is unstable and he often faces daily challenges in his effort to make a living. Shoroq received a USD 800 loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy some construction materials to be used to complete the family’s new home.

loans.use: to buy some construction materials to be used to complete the family’s new home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 27-years-old and the father of one child. 


Ali owns a butchery. He sells fresh sheep meat. He established his business in 2009 and through practice, he gained good experience in this field. Ali now has two hired employees and is well-known in the market thanks to his fresh food and affordable prices.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD in order to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his butchery. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter, an external ceiling and signage for his butchery.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers catering services for the marriage occasion of people which includes food and refreshments for the guests. Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband requires additional capital for the growth of his business. He would use the Kiva loan to purchase utensils, crockery and food items to offer more varieties to his clients. Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase catering items

loans.name: Aida Nohemi

texts.es:
La Sra. Aida Nohemi es originaria de la cd. de Monterrey, tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace 13 años por cuestiones de trabajo, estudió ciencias de la educación y desde hace 24 años ha ejercido su profesión, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya todos se casaron y son independientes. Todas las mañanas se despierta a muy temprana hora para preparar su día y material de trabajo, pués ayuda a todos los niños que necesitan clases extras para poder aprender, esto lo hace en dos escuelas de Piedras Negras.
Es una persona que le gusta superarse en la vida, pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder instalar porton de metal y así tener más seguridad en su domicilio ya que  hoy en día se vive con mucha inseguridad y pués ella trabaja la mayor parte del día, ella quisiera en un futuro poder realizar otras mejoras en su vivienda para así poder impartir clases gratuitas fuera de su domicilio a todos aquellos niños que tiene problemas para aprender  y que necesitan ayuda.
texts.en:
Aida Nohemi is originally from the city of Monterrey but for 13 years has been living in Piedras Negras for work purposes.  She got a degree in education and has been working in her profession for 24 years.  She is the mother of three children who are all married and independent.

Every morning she gets up very early to prepare her work materials for the day.  She helps children who need extra classes in order to learn and she does this in two schools in Piedras Negras.

She is a person who likes to improve her living conditions, so she is requesting a KIVA loan to install a large metal door for more security at home.  She now lives with a lot of insecurity and works most of the day, so in the future she would like to renovate her home and give free classes outside the home to children with learning problems who need help.

loans.use: To install a large metal door.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru: Собиру 49 лет. Он семьянин и заботливый отец троих детей. Собир со своей любимой семьей проживает в городе Вахдат, расположенный недалеко от столицы. Собир имеет среднее специальное образование. В данный момент он занимается услугой маршрутного такси и обеспечивает семью за счет ежедневного дохода, получаемого с деятельности. Собир работает таксистом последние 7 лет. Этот вид деятельности всегда востребован в городе Вахдат поэтому многие жители занимаются услугой такси. Собир запрашивает кредит для приобретения запасных частей машины, чтобы отремонтировать свой автомобиль и продолжить свою работу.
texts.en:
Sobir is 49 years old.  He is a family man and a devoted father of his three children.  Sobir lives with his beloved family in Vahdat, which is located not far from the capital.  Sobir has a secondary level technical education.   At the present, he is in business as a fixed-route taxi driver and he provides for his family with his daily earnings.  Sobir has been a taxi driver for seven years.  Many residents of Vahdat work as taxi drivers because this service is always in demand.

Sobir is requesting a loan to buy repair parts for his car, so he can fix his car and continue his work.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and invest in his business.

loans.name: Nuzhat

texts.en: Nuzhat is a 44-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She has been successfully running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband for six years. She has two buffaloes that produce milk. She sells it to many of her neighbors along with butter and yogurt that she makes from the milk. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. For the further improvement of her business, she is applying for a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo and some cans for milk storage. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business as well as dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo and some cans for milk storage.

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Sandra es originaria de Oaxaca, tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace 9 años, tuvo que migrar por el empleo de su esposo y como les gusto la ciudad decidieron quedarse  a vivir en Piedras Negras. La Sra. Sandra es una persona muy productiva y emprendedora ya que se dedica a la venta de productos americanos,  los cuales vende a las amas de casa ya que son para la cocina y de muy buena calidad,  su esposo trabaja como mecánico en una empresa que vende autos, ellos solo tienen un hijo pero ya es independiente y tiene su propia familia.
La Sra. Sandra pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder remodelar por fuera de su casa, empezando a pintarla toda alrededor ya que con la pintura que cuenta se encuentra muy deteriorada y así tener una casa que luzca bonita y agradable para cuando la visite su familia de fuera de la ciudad  se sientan comodos.
texts.en:
Sandra is originally from Oxaca but has been living in Piedras Negras for nine years.  She had to migrate due to her husband's employment and since they liked the city of Piedras Negras they decided to live there.  Sanda is a very productive entrepreneur who sells quality American cooking products to homemakers.  Her husband works as a mechanic for a car dearler.  They only have one son who is independent and has his own family.

Sandra is requesting a loan through KIVA to renovate the outside of her home.  She wants to start by painting the outside which is very worn so the house will look nicer and feel more comfortable for out-of-town family to visit.

loans.use: To paint her house.

loans.name: Beqir

texts.en:
Beqir is 48 years old, married, and has three children. His children are between the ages of 14 and 17 and are all attending school. He and his family live in a village in Kosovo. 

For more than 10 years now Beqir has worked transporting goods for others with his truck. He usually carries and transports different things depending on the needs and requests of his customers. Sometimes he has even carried furniture from one city to another as a means to earn a living. 

Now Beqir needs to buy new tires for his truck and get some mechanical repairs done in the auto repair shop. This loan will help him to be able to continue his business. He hopes in the future to improve the living conditions for his family. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new tires for truck

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. María  de 48 años de edad empezó  hace un año con un pequeño negocio de la venta de comida  chatarra tal como Duritos, Tostadas Nachos y mas y comenta que le ha marchado muy bien, el único problema es que está ubicada en el patio frontal de su domicilio con una  pequeña estructura a la intemperie ella quiere construir un pequeño cuarto  para poder utilizarlo como local para su negocio es por eso que el día de hoy está solicitando un préstamo para poder llevar a cabo la  construcción de un pequeño local, ella agradecerá el apoyo que se le pueda brindar, ella tiene planeado pagar el préstamo en 14 meses  con las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 48, started her small snack food (Doritos, Tostadas Nachos, etc.) business one year ago.  She says it has gone well except for the fact that she works off the front porch of her house which is small and outdoors.  She wants to build a small room to use as a shop and is requesting a loan to pay for it. 

She is grateful for the support and committed to paying back the loan in 14 months with profits from her business.

loans.use: To build a shop for her business.

loans.name: Karla Karina

texts.es: La Sra. Karla  de 37 años de edad  es una persona muy respetuosa y trabajadora ella es divorciada  actualmente ella tiene una pequeña  Boutique de Ropa y Renta de Zapatos y Vestidos de Fiesta,  ella tiene que sacar adelante el negocio ya que es la unica fuente de ingresos  para ella y sus  dos pequeños hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando , en esta ocasión requiere el crédito para comprar mercancía para su negocio y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes  mayor variedad de Ropa y Zapatos , ella tiene planeado liquidar su prestamo en 6 meses.
texts.en:
Karla, 37, is a very respectful, hard-working person who is divorced.  She runs a small boutique where she sells clothing and rents party dresses and shoes.  She must prosper in her business since it is the only source of income for her and her two young school-aged children.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business so she can offer her customers a wider variety of clothing and shoes.  She is committed to paying back the loan in six months.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and party dresses.

loans.name: Sountongnoma Group

texts.fr:
Mme G. Ivonne représente le groupe SOUNTONGNOMA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes a sa charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 16ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 22complets de pagnes.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle souhaite agrandir son champ d’activité et aider son époux dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
G. Ivonne is the representative of the SOUNTONGNOMA group.  She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  Her oldest child is 35 years old, the youngest is 12.  Two of her children are in school, and she supports six additional persons.

She has been selling "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) for the past 16 years.  She buys her merchandise at the District 10 market and sells to both men and women.

She wants to buy 22 pagnes, each measuring 3 x 1 meters.

She wants to save her profits in order to boost her business.  She would like to expand her activity and help her husband cover the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 22 "pagnes", each measuring 3 x 1 meters.

loans.name: Danaya Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DANAYA II sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Diassela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KONIMBA la deuxième personne à gauche dans le rang des debout compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.5 hectare d'arachide et du mil en association avec le haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice  de 110 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the DANAYA group are married women. They are 42 years old on average and have an average of four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Diassela, a village in the Koulikoro region, in the second administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they plant include peanut, millet, and beans. 

This is their third collaboration with the institution. With this new loan, KONIMBA, the second person from the left in the front row, would like to buy farm inputs, equipment, and plowing for about 0.5 hectares of peanuts and millet together with beans. 

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the village of Beleco to a clientele of men and women. She would like to earn a profit of 110,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and equipment.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 56 years old, married to Moses, and blessed with children who are now between the ages of 15 and 38. She practices dairy farming alongside a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. She ventured into this business 20 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 55,000 to purchase bales of flour, crates of eggs, and sacks of sugar and rice. The profit she earns will generate more income for her business.

Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman in this region.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, crates of eggs, and sacks of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 50 years old, married, and supports a family of four. He runs a retail shop in Kapsabet town and this has been his income-generating business for the last four years. He gets an average monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 30,000, and with this loan he intends to purchase more stock for his retail shop, i.e., a 50kg bag of sugar, 50kg of cooking fat, 100 bar soaps, and two bags of rice. He anticipates getting profits which he intends use to expand his business by increasing his stock to meet his clients' demand.

Benson hopes and dreams of saving money to enable him to pay school fees for his children as well as expand his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 50 years old, married, and supports a family of ten. He runs a retail shop (kiosk) and this has been his income-generating business for the last five years. He gets an average monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES. 30,000, and with this loan he intends to buy tea leaves, two cartons of salt, and maize flour for sale. 

He anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand his business by increasing his inventory to meet his clients' demand.

Daniel hopes to improve his living standards and be financially stable; he also hopes to save money to enable him to pay school fees for his children as well as expanding his business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, two cartons of salt, and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Tarweh

texts.en:
Please meet 48-year-old Tarweh from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas, and its residents often live in sub-standard housing. 

Tarweh completed 12 grades in school and is married. His wife is a businesswoman. Tarweh has three children between the ages of 2 and 18. They are in school, and they all live at home. 

Tarweh has owned his own shop selling rice, oil, milk, mayonnaise, butter and other items for the past three years. He will use the loan to purchase more rice, oil, milk, mayonnaise and butter.

On average, Tarweh works 13 hours a day at his business. He started his business with money from his father. He transports his merchandise by bus. He cites rainy season as his biggest challenge. His favorite part of his business is the flow of customers. In the future, he would like to build a house. 

He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, milk, mayonnaise, butter, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 22 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is unmarried and she stopped her education at the sixth grade. Patience has two children ages 5 and 2 who live at home and only one of them is attending school. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past seven years, Patience has been selling rice and soup in the local market. She sells six days a week from 7am to 5pm. She likes her business because she has more customers and she started this business with money given to her by her fiancee. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her food ingredients at her business spot. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, coal, etc. for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, pepper, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Boakais

texts.en:
Please meet 42-year-old Boakais from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

He completed 12 grades in school and is married.  He describes himself as a hardworking person. 

Boakais has a shop which sells soft drinks by the crate. He has been in business for four years and works 10 hours per day.  With this loan, he will buy more crates of soft drinks. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is low inventory in his shop. He transports his goods by bus. He started his business with money from his father. He is proud of his business because of the profit that he makes. His plan is to own a house. He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Elochuklu

texts.en:
Elochuklu is 34 years old and lives in New Kru Town, an early community in Liberia which is well-known in Liberia. He is married, and he is a high school graduate. His wife sell charcoal. They have a 2-year-old child who is presently attending school.

For the past eight years, he has been running a general shop in the community, selling milk, toothpaste, oil, rice, etc. Elochuklu makes a lot of profit since he is the only one who is involved in this business, and he sells quality products. Some problem he faces is less income. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, toothpaste, oil, rice, etc., for his business. He plans to build a house for his family in the years to come and educate his child. He sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, toothpaste, oil, rice, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Luvenia

texts.en:
This is 33 year old Luvenia from Liberia.  She resides in Paynesville South, a suburb just outside Monrovia.  The area is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County with one of the best standards of living in the country.  Good roads, access to clean water, affordable rents and plentiful transportation options make Paynesville South one of the most popular places to live. 
She is a widow and has a 10 month old child and Luvenia is a college student.

She runs a gas station.  She describes herself as hard working woman. She started her business 10 years ago, using money from her late fiancee.  Typically, she works 10 hours a day at her business and transports her goods to her business by tanker.  She cites her greatest challenge as the price of petrol.  She is proud of her business because it helps to sustain her family.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase gasoline and fuel oil.  In the future, she plans to open a modern gas station.  She sincerely thanks you in advanced for your support.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and fuel oil.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 43-year-old Alpha from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. He is a married father with six children between the ages of 2 years and 20 years old. His children are attending school. 

Alpha runs a spare parts business; he sells motor oil, transmission fluid, brake kits and electric fans. He has been running this business for 13 years. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 6 days per week. He is faced with transportation problems and high cost of goods.

Alpha has requested a loan in order to purchase motor oil, transmission fluid, brake kits and inner tires and binding wire.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to pay his children school fees and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open another shop in a different community. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase motor oil, transmission fluid, brake kits and inner tires, and binding wire.

loans.name: Lami

texts.en:
Meet Lami, He is in his late 30s and comes from Tombo, a town in the eastern part of Sierra Leone. He is married, and has two children aged five and ten years. His children are currently attending school. In 2001, Lami established his grocery business in the Tombo community. He began his business, because he wanted to create a permanent source of income to support his family and to educate his children. He works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are slow sales in the rainy season, and the high cost of rent.

Lami requires a loan in order to purchase more items to resell at his store, such as soft drinks, cigarettes, pure water and fishing equipment. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will enable him to become more successful and pay his children's school fees. In the future, Lami plans to expand his enterprise and build a permanent business location. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items to resell at his store

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 44-year-old Adama from Waterloo Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with five children between the ages of 7 years and 16 years. Two of her children are attending school. She grew up in a business-oriented home, so she decided to take business as her own profession.  

Adama runs a fertilizers business within a busy Market; she sells fertilizer, spraying machines and water cans. She has been running this business for ten years. She works at the business every day, twelve hours per day.  Adama says that the main challenge to her business is that transporting her goods from the city to her business place is very difficult. During the dry season, sales are very slow.

Adama has requested a loan in order to purchase agricultural items, including fertilizer, spraying machines and water cans for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a plot of land and renovate her house. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase agricultural items, including fertilizer, spraying machines and water cans for resale.

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Ramadhani who is in his early 40s, is married with one child who is still very small. He has been running a studio business where he does video production. He has been in this business for four years now. He works from  8.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ramadhani's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use it to buy another camera for his video business. He dreams of buying a printing machine. 

Ramadhani will share this loan with his loan group "SINGIDA" which has ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy another camera for his video business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Aminata from Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 years and 23 years. Her children are going to school. 

Aminata runs a pharmacy in Jui Community; she sells a variety of medical drugs such as malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business six days per week from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  Aminata describes her major problems as poor electricity supply and transporting the drugs from Freetown to her storehouse.  

Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and improve her level of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a hospital and employ the youth in that particular community. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more malarial drugs, blood syrup and cholera drugs

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Massah from Kandeh town in the southern area of Freetown. She is married with two children,  ages 6 months and 3 years. One of her children is attending school. 

Massah runs a general store business; she sell a variety of assorted drinks, soaps, and bread. She has been running this business for the past eight years. She works at the business ten hours a day throughout the week. She says that her business is doing well and her customer rate is increasing.

Massah has requested a loan to purchase food items such as assorted drinks, pure water, and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to become more successful. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items such as assorted drinks, pure water, and sugar.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old and a single mother of two children. 

She runs a beauty salon business, which she started three years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She has requested KADET LTD to fund her a fourth loan of KES 50,000 to pay university fees for one of her children. Her dream and desire is to see her children living successful lives.

loans.use: To pay university fees for her child.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 39 years old and married with three children. She has a salon business in Kangundo town. She also sells various beauty products in her salon. She has been in this business for the past nine years. She currently makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

This will be her fourth loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy more beauty products to sell.
