These include sprays, deodorants and perfumes, hairbands, braids and weaves, hair oil, body lotions, and hair chemicals, just to mention a few. She will use the anticipated income to start a boutique business.

She hopes to open more salon businesses in Kangundo town while also opening a boutique parlor, hence becoming successful in business. 

Hellen also hopes to make more income and be able to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 43 years old and married with three children, ages 3 years to 21 years. He runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. One of his children is going to school and he has four additional dependents at home.

He has been in this business since 2001 and sells fish in the provinces.  He says that the main challenge to his business is delay in transporting his goods.

Osman requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more cartons of fish for resale. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, he would like to have a fishing boat. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old mother from the Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Anaye, who is also a businessman from in the same location. She supports five people in her family, including three children who are 18, 15 and 10 years old respectively.

She operates a business selling second-hand clothes, which she has been doing for the last 10 years, generating a monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more second-hand clothes and she plans to reinvest the anticipated profit in the business.

Her dream is to become a supplier of second-hand clothes and educate her children.

loans.use: to increase her stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is 26, married to Bernard, and blessed with a 10-year-old child. She has been selling fish for the past five years and has seen her business grow steadily into a wholesale. She now earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) after boosting her stock with the first loan that she borrowed. 

She wishes to boost her business further and has requested a second loan of 40,000 KES to aid her in purchasing more fish to meet the high demand. The profit she earns would contribute towards her purchasing a piece of land. 

She hopes to lead a stable life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 34 years old and married with two children. He is in the motorcycle transport business in Tala town, and has been in this business for the past six years. Besides this, he also sells milk.

This will be his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the loan amount to service his motorcycle so that it is in good condition. He will buy new tubes and tires and also replace the parts that are worn out with new spare parts. He also plans to buy more milk for resale in his dairy shop. He will use the income that he generates to pay school fees for his children.

In future, Raphael hopes to buy a dairy cow and venture more into dairy farming.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 53 years old, married and blessed with seven children of whom five have their own families and don't depend on her. She runs a small-scale farming business and her husband supports her in running the business and producing additional income. She has been in this business for the last five years. From this business she gets a monthly profit of KES. 15,000. 

She has borrowed a loan of KES. 55,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase fertilizers for top dressing.  She anticipates getting profit and she plans to use it to expand her business as well as diversify her business by improving her dairy cows to increase her income.

Her hopes is to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her two children who still depend on her as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase top dressing fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for home use.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: EL Sr. Israel de  42 años y su esposa  Blanca de 38 años tienen dos hijos  Antonio de 19 años y una adolescente de 17 que con esfuerzo y mucha dedicación  han  podido sacar  adelante,  el día de hoy  está  solicitando un crédito para terminar la construcción  del cuarto de la segunda  planta pero para poder terminar el cuarto necesita comprar cemento, yeso y pintura  es por eso que el  requiere  el préstamo  para poder comprar  lo que le  hace falta y así  terminar el cuarto para  uno de sus hijos ya que cada día  van creciendo  y cada  quien quiere  su propio espacio y quieren tener su recamara independiente, el agradecerá  el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Israel is 42 years old, and his wife Blanca is 38. They have two children: Antonio, who is 19, and a daughter who is 17. With much hard work and dedication they have been able to get them ahead. Today he is asking for a loan to finish construction on a room on the second floor. In order to finish the room he needs to buy cement, plaster and paint. That is why he needs the loan- to buy what he needs and finish the room for one of his children. They are growing every day and each one wants his or her own space and room. He will be grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy cement, plaster and paint to finish construction.

loans.name: Isamary

texts.es:
La Sra. Isamary es originaria de Piedras Negras, lugar donde ha vivido toda su vida, es la cabeza de su familia siendo madre de 3 hijas, aunque su nivel de estudio solamente fue hasta primaria con esfuerzo y dedicación ha salido adelante, ya que desde su corta edad, aprendió hacer nives de garrafa, y hoy es un negocio que le permite generar ingreso para los pagos de su casa, además le da empleo a dos personas, pues ella hace la nieve de garrafa y luego se las lleva a sus trabajadoras para que las vendan, es propietaria de dos taxis, los cuales trabajan las 24 horas del día ya que los renta.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para comprar más contenedores para seguir haciendo sus ricas nieves de garrafa, ya que con los que cuenta se encuentran algo deteriorados y en un futuro ampliar su negocio en un lugar establecido, siempre tratando de ofrecer las mejores nieves de garrafa y las mas ricas de Piedras Negras.
texts.en:
Isamary is from Piedras Negras, where she has lived her whole life. She is a head of household and the mother of three daughters. Although she only went to primary school with hard work and dedication she has gotten ahead. When she was very young, she learned how to make nieves de garrafa [sherbets] and today it is a business that allows her to generate income to make her house payments and employ two people. She makes the nieve de garrafa and her worker take it to be sold. She owns two taxis, which she rents out and are worked 24 hours a day.

She is asking for support through Kiva to buy more containers to keep making her delicious nieves de garrafa. The ones she has have deteriorated. In the future she wants to expand her business with an established locale, always trying to offer the best nieves de garrafa and the most delicious ones in Piedras Negras.

loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en:
Luljeta plants and sells wheat and corn and she has been doing this for almost twenty years.  She is being photographed here in the field of wheat that she has planted. Luljeta wants to buy corn seeds and pesticides for the plants with this loan.

Luljeta is 42 and has two children, seventeen and fourteen, who currently go to high school. They live in the southeastern Albania, known for the quantity and quality of wheat and corn produce. They sell their produce to wholesalers. “Some years, the cold and the flooding severely damage our plants and crops and we basically get nothing out of all this investment, whether financial or physical. Yet these are the difficulties that almost every farmer faces, ” Luljeta said.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Ilda es originaria de la cd. de Piedras Negras, lugar donde ha vivido toda su vida, desde muy joven se dedico a  la venta de comida por las calles, hoy en día tiene un negocio de venta de hamburguesas, nachos, papas con queso, al igual como es temporada de calor vende bolis y mangonadas, vive con su marido del cuál se caso hace dos años ya que se caso grande de edad pero muy enamorada e ilusionada, él trabaja en la construcción en E.U., y con mucho esfuerzo juntos están construyendo su casa, pues actualmente viven en una casa prestada por el hermano de la Sra. Ilda.
La Sra. Ilda pide apoyo através de KIVA para seguir construyendo su casa, ya que quisiera realizar acabados exteriores para así pronto cambiarse a su casa propia, e ir construyendo poco a poco hasta lograr tener un patrimonio bonito y agradable.
texts.en:
Señora Ilda is a native of the city of Piedras Negras, where she has lived all of her life. From a young age she has worked as a street food vendor. Today she has a business selling hamburgers, nachos, potatoes with cheese, as well as ice pops and mangonadas (a cold mango dessert) in hot weather. She lives with her husband who she married 2 years ago since she married at an older age but she is thrilled and very much in love. He works as a construction worker in the U.S., and with a lot of effort they are building their house together, as they currently live in a house lent to them by Señora Ilda's brother.

Señora Ilda is asking for support through Kiva so that they can continue building their house, since she wants to put exterior finishes to the house to make it her own, and continue building bit by bit until she has a nice, beautiful property.

loans.use: to put exterior finishes on her house.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 44 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in raising ducks to produce eggs to sell for more than ten years, earning approximately $25 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $5 each day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, Chanthou is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more ducks for breeding. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her poultry farm and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband who joined her in the picture is employed in a garment factory. He earns about $4 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Chanthou is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase timber to fix her house. This purchase will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to fix her house

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch is 30 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband who joined her in the picture is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sreytouch is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase timber to build a new house. The purchase will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop at home and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. In addition, he goes fishing to make more income to financially support the family. 

In order to improve the fishing business, Rithy is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a boat to use for fishing. This purchase will help him increase his fishing yield and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business related to animal husbandry and send her children to a good school. Currently, she is saving some money to build a new house shortly.

loans.use: to purchase a boat to use for fishing.

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa  Isela de  34 años es una  mujer  emprendedora y respetuosa  ella   inicio  su negocio  de Venta de Tostadas y Tacos  tipo Siberia  nos comenta  que su negocio le ha  marchado muy bien, en el credito anterior ella tenie el pequeño negocio de  la venta  de juguetes para la temporada Navideña dice que las ventas fuertes de ese negocio solamente son en las temporadas navideñas.  nos comenta que  a pesar de que tiene solamente 6  meses con su negocio ya tiene  clientes frecuentes que le dicen que están  muy sabrosas sus tostadas  y le recomiendan más  gente ella  está  muy  feliz  con su negocio  ya que este negocio es el  que le da la fuerza para   sacar adelante a su familia ,  el negoci o es la única fuente de ingreso para sus hijos  Isela  de 3 años y  Julio de 7 , ella tiene planes de comprar otro carrito para la venta de Tacos a  Vapor Mañaneros es por  eso que el día de hoy está solicitando un crédito para  poder comprar el carrito para Tacos  a Vapor y así poder vender los tacos  por la Mañana y en el transcurso de la tarde seguir con su  Venta  de Tacos y Tostadas tipo  Siberia,   ella  agradece el apoyo que se le pueda  brindar y tiene planeado liquidar su préstamo en 10 meses  con las ganancias que le genere su negocio.
texts.en:
34-year-old Rosa Isela is an entrepreneurial, respectful woman who has a business selling Siberia style tostadas and tacos.  She tells us that her business is doing very well.

Rosa Isela used her previous loan to set up a small business selling toys over the Christmas period.  She says that sales from this type of business are only strong over the Christmas period.  She says that, in spite of the fact that she has only been in business for 6 months, she already has repeat customers who tell her that her tostadas are very tasty and who recommend her to others.  She is very happy with her business as it allows her to provide for her family.  This business is the only source of income for her children: 3-year-old Isela and 7-year-old Julio.

Rosa Isela has plans to buy another cart for selling steamed tacos.  It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan.  She will buy a cart for selling  steamed tacos in the morning.  In the afternoons, she will continue selling her Siberia style tacos and tostadas.  Rosa Isela is grateful for the support she is receiving and plans to pay back her loan in 10 months with the profits that she makes from her business.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling tacos

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb is 39 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working as construction worker for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her children are employed. They earn about $5 per day. Due to lack of funds, Chreb is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. This money will help her provide hygienic living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home to generate extra income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en: Socheat is 43 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working with her daughter in a garment factory for more than a year, earning approximately $8 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Socheat is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for farming. Specifically, she will grow rice. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. With this additional income, she hopes she can support her children while they earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for farming

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Sophal is 39 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been buying junk materials to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $11 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who makes an income of $5 per day. 

In order to improve her business, Sophal is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a trailer to use for carrying junk materials to sell. This purchase will help her carry junk materials in larger amounts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a bathroom to provide hygienic living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer to carry junk materials to sell

loans.name: Puthy

texts.en: Puthy is 28 years old. She is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They have been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $8 daily. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Puthy is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expense and get to work on time. In the future, she would like to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 41 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish paste and smoked fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $5 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Mom is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase more fish paste and smoked fish to sell. By doing so, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fish paste and smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Mahoro Group

texts.fr: La cliente Serafina  est conseillère du groupe d’affaire  « Mahoro», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont certains ont déjà leurs familles respectives. Son conjoint est un mâcon constructeur. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle installe ses produits au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, Il y a environ 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 fût  d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Hekima client Serafina is the head of this business group called « Mahoro», their elder and an entrepreneur with wide experience, aged 54, married and the mother of eight children, some of whom already have their own families. Her husband is a mason and builder. The borrower sells palm oil. She displays her products along the street and sometimes in her house. She began her business with an MFI Hekima loan about five years ago. 

This new loan will serve to allow her to buy one barrel of palm oil. In this way, she hopes to grow her working capital, put her children in school, and feed them. Finally, she thanks Hekima sincerely for supporting small entrepreneurs with microloans.

loans.use: to buy one barrel of palm oil.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 59 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $5 daily. Her children are employed. They are garment workers and a construction worker. They earn about $16 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Pheap is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to purchase more construction tools to be able to build bigger construction and fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en:
Noeun is 58 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rope for more than three years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $14 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Noeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar es originario de San Luis Potosí, tiene 33 años de edad esta casado con la señora Maria Elena con quien tiene 3 hijos de edad escolar. El señor Oscar es empleado de una compañía donde realizan la madera y su esposa trabaja para una fábrica en el aria de producción.
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que les esta haciendo falta el vitropiso de los cuartos de sus hijos, y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el Sr. Oscar se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su empleo.
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo es para pagar el crédito y que con el ingreso de su esposa es para los gastos familiares y escolares.
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que tengan un lugar mas seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Oscar is from San Luis Potosí.  He is 33 years old and married to Maria Elena, with whom he has three school-age children.  Oscar works for a company that prepares wood.  His wife works in a factory on the production side.

Oscar is requesting a loan as he needs to tile the floors in his children's bedrooms but doesn't have enough money to buy the materials.  Oscar himself will carry out this home improvement when he is not at work.

Oscar will pay back his loan with his salary.  His wife's income will be used to cover family and school expenses.

Oscar would like to improve his family's quality of life and provide them with a safer place in which to live.

loans.use: to lay tiled flooring

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a Kiva borrower and is 35 years old. She is married and has six children. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a tailoring business and has been in this business for four years. She operates the business in a competitive area. The challenge she faces is lack of capital to improve her business.

She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to add a stock of cloth and other tailoring materials. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business. In five years time she wants to own many sewing machines.

loans.use: to add a stock of cloth and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 39-year-old man who is married and has four children. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a phone repair shop and has been in this business for three years. He operates the business in a competitive area. He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy mobile phone chargers, batteries and other electronics to sell. 

He faces a challenge of lack of capital to expand his business. He wants to own a big shop in five years time.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone chargers, batteries and other electronics to sell.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is 28 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been growing water spinach to sell for more than a year, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Chanda is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase timber to rebuild the wall of her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. 

In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber to rebuild the wall of her house.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von is 52 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 per day.

Due to the difficulty of her family’s transportation situation, Von is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce their transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to improve her house and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 48 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working as construction worker for more than three years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $3 each day. Two of her children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ny is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell. In addition, a part of this money will be used to pay for getting a new driving license for her son. 

This money will help her have the ability to run a new business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she will expand her business and plans to rebuild her house next year.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 42 years old. She is married and resides with seven children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, San is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timber and zinc to build a stable to keep cattle. This money will help her to have an appropriate place to keep her cattle. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a stable to keep cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Verónica tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Oscar con quien tiene dos hijas de que están estudiando la primaria, son originario de Nuevo Laredo.
Tiene dedicándose más de 4 años a la venta de ropa usada y su esposo el señor Oscar es empleado de un taller de autos. Están solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía nueva ya que sus clientes le están solicitando ropa más moderna, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión ya que no quieren descapitalizar el negocio.
Desea que su negocio tenga mejor calidad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y así tener también mejor ingreso.
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio es para pagar el crédito y que con el sueldo del empleo de su esposo es para los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Rosa Verónica is 34 years old and is married to Oscar, with whom she has two daughters who are in elementary school.  They are from Nuevo Laredo.

Rosa Verónica has been selling used clothing for over four years.  Her husband is employed in an auto repair shop.  Rosa Verónica is requesting a loan to invest in buying new merchandise as her customers are asking her for more modern clothing but she doesn't have the money she needs to make this investment as she doesn't want to take money out of her business.

Rosa Verónica will pay back her loan with the profits she makes from her business.  Her husband's salary will be used to cover family and school expenses.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Rom is 38 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband runs the business of purchasing cattle to resell. He earns about $7 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her farming process, Rom is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce her farming expenses and grow rice faster. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children complete higher education. She also wants to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo is 51 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $13 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Keo is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. By doing so, he would generate additional income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her youngest child go on to higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Olivia Meseh

texts.en:
Olivia Meseh is married and has three children. They live in a four bedroom apartment house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to effectively carryout her business activities, paying her children's fees, and providing three square meals to her family.

Olivia Meseh has taken and successfully repaid her loans twice and says that with this new loan she will expand her poultry farm by buying more chicks and feeders, building more cages, and also buying a new motorbike, with part of this loan added to her savings from the last loan repaid. Olivia Meseh holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing this business for a long time. The transportation business will enable community members to carry their produce form the farms to the market, transport children to and form school, and carry workers to and from work.

With the profit from this loan, Olivia Meseh will engage in poultry farming, help with her granddaughter's education, and take care of other necessities in the family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy chicks, add feeders, build cages, and buy a motorbike

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old man who is married and has three children. He describes himself as determined. David operates a workshop where he sells tables, chairs, and stools. He has been in this business for three years. He does his business in a competitive area.

David faces a challenge of lack of capital. He will use this loan of KES 30,000 to add stock of tables, chairs, and stools to sell. In five years time he wants to own a big hardware shop. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He repaid his previous loan successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of tables, chairs, and stools to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 30-year-old man who is married and has one child. He describes himself as faithful, understanding and honest. He operates a cereals shop where he sells maize, beans, peas and rice. He has been in this business for four years.

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to add a stock of maize, beans, peas and rice to sell. His customers are domestic customers and schools. He faces a challenge of lack of enough stock.

He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family living standards. In five years time he wants to be a general supplier. He also keeps livestock and does farming to supplement his income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of maize, beans, peas and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 35-year-old woman who is married and has two children. She describes herself as successful. She runs a retail store where she sells second-hand clothes. Her customers are the general public. She faces a challenge of lack of funds.

She will use the loan of KES 50,000 to add a stock of second-hand clothes to sell and will also buy a motorbike. She will use the anticipated profits to add to her stock of clothes. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and her previous loan was paid back successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of second-hand clothes to sell and buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man and has three children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail store where he sells second hand clothes. He does his business in an area that is highly competitive. He faces a challenge of changing fashions. His primary customers are male.

He will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy three bales of second hand clothes to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. In five years time he wants to be selling a wider variety of clothes. His previous business was selling fruits.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM, and his previous loans were paid back successfully.

loans.use: to buy three bales of second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives in Mombasa, Kenya. 38, she is a wife and mother of two. For three years she has been selling cereals. She discovered Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 85,050 KES to buy five sacks of rice and beans. She hopes that her business will be wholesale in five years and the major challenge that she faces is her customers not paying in the required time. The extra income she will get will be used to educate her child and improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bundles of maize meal, three sacks of sugar and rice and sixty liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Eclay

texts.en:
Eclay is a 57-year-old woman who is married and has five children aged between 20 and 35 years. She describes herself as focused, customer oriented, honest and spiritual. She operates a retail shop where she sells milk, sugar, bread, soft drinks and other items. She has been in this business for three years.

She has taken a loan of KES 50,000 which she will use to add a stock of milk, sugar, bread, soft drinks, cooking oil and other items to sell. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and increase her stock of items. In five years time she wants to own a supermarket. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid back successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of milk, sugar, bread, soft drinks, cooking oil and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building her house

loans.name: Erdenekhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenekhuyag is 39 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He and his wife have been rendering taxi service to local people using only one automobile night and day, respectively. Before this job, Erdenekhuyag worked at a building site from 1994 to 2006. 

Erdenekhuyag is requesting a loan of 2,700,000 MNT to purchase one additional automobile, which runs on natural gas, in order to increase his family's income. If he and his wife both work day and night without shifting, his family income will double and they can afford to cover his son's higher education expenses. Erdenekhuyag is a very hardworking individual who wants to improve his family's life.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two sacks of beans, maize meal and a bale of kales.

loans.name: Nzioka

texts.en: Nzioka is a married man. He has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 17. He describes himself as ambitious and honest. He operates an electronics shop where he repairs mobile phones and sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as economic instability. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy electronics to sell . His goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, will educate his children and buy a piece of land. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy electronics to sell.

loans.name: Pamellah

texts.en:
Pamellah is a 40-year-old married woman with four children aged between four and 16. She describes herself as ambitious, a go-getter and optimistic. She operates a retail shop where she sells consumable products like sugar, salt, cooking oil and other products. Her business is located in a busy area which is good for business.

She will use the loan of KES 40,000 to add stock of consumable products like sugar, flour, salt, cooking oil etc. The challenge she faces is lack of enough finances to increase her stock.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and plough money back into the business. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to add a stock of consumable products like sugar, flour, salt and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten crates of drinks

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and a father of one. 

He has been in the transport business for more than four years. The major challenge he has been facing is a way of accessing capital.

He knew Milango through his friends and now seeks a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy spare part for his motorcycle. He wants to change his living standards with the income from the loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beans, cowpeas and vegetables.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself as honest. Daniel operates a business where he sells firewood and he has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. Daniel describes his biggest business challenge as economic instability. 

Daniel will use this KES 20,000 loan to add stock of firewood to sell. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as honest to his customers. 

He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat to customers. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He also sells fruits to earn extra income. He describes his biggest business challenge as perishability of meat. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to open two more butcheries within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as economic instability. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more meat to sell. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark lives in Ukunda about 30 miles south of Mombasa, Kenya. This 30-year-old father of four operates a grocery shop. He has been in this business for more than two years now. He has been having a challenge in transporting the goods from his suppliers to his own place. 

Mark knew of Milango through a friend and now seeks a loan of 99,100 Kenyan shillings to buy a motorbike that will help him overcome his challenge. He also wants to open a wholesale shop in the near future. The additional income he earns as a result of this loan use will pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and a mother of two school-going children. For six years now, this thirty-seven-year-old mother has been selling second-hand clothes. This is her source of income. 

Ruth knew of Milango through a friend and since she was in need of credit to further her business she joined. She now seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy five bales of second-hand clothes for resale. She has an ambition of owning a boutique in five years. She will use her extra income as a result of this loan to pay school fees for her children. The major challenge that she faces is price fluctuation.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 42, is a husband and a father of two school-going children who lives Mombasa, Kenya. 

He sells shoes for a living and he has done this for the past seven years. The challenge he faces is lack of capital for expanding the business.

He found out about Milango through his business associates, and he joined, wanting to access credit. David now seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy five bales of second-hand shoes for resale. He plans to be a wholesaler in the next five years. The income from the loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy 5 bales of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Esinala

texts.en:
Esinala is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself as hopeful. 

She operates a grocery store where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are retailers and wholesalers. She describes her biggest business challenges as lack of commodities and transport problems. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide employment to other people. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more fruits for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as talkative. David operates a welding shop where he sells metal doors and windows and he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

David will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more metal for his welding business. His business goal is to own a hardware shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children up to the graduate level. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more metal for his welding business

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Marta tem 47 anos de idade, é operaria agrícola e trabalha da 6.30 as 15.00hrs. Vive maritalmente e desta relação tem 6 filhos, dos quais apenas 1 estuda e os outros já são maiores de idade. Sustenta também 2 netos que vivem com ela.
Pretende comprar areia e cimento para fabricar blocos, para fazer uma casa para arrendar para reforçar a renda familiar. Já tem na sua casa duas dependências arrendadas.
No futuro tem planos de ampliar a casa onde ela vive com mais um quarto.
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente as suas prestações e voltar a pedir novos créditos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old, is a farmer for a large company and works from 06:30 to 15:00. She lives with her longtime partner and has 6 children from this relationship, only one of whom still goes to school as the others are of age. She also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.

She plans to buy sand and cement to manufacture blocks in order to build a house to rent and reinforce her family's income. She already has two houses which she rents out.

In future she plans to expand the house where she lives by adding another room.

Marta says she will pay her monthly dues on time and will request further loans to fund her future plans.

loans.use: buy sand and cement to manufacture blocks in order to build a house to rent and reinforce her family's income

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan, 28 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling mobile phone accessories to local people by renting a stall at a trade center for one year. Before this job, he used to render taxi services around the city. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase phone accessories in large quantity from China at lower prices so that he can continue to run his sales business without worrying about inventory shortages. Batsaikhan is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply for his mother.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Batkhuyag, 55 years old, lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Batkhuyag has been transporting tourists to the countryside using his minivan. His son has a job at the police department. His wife has been running a pub by renting an old apartment basement for one year and each passing day, the number of customers is increasing greatly. 

So Batkhuyag is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase a freezer and beer in large quantity. As a result, his wife's business will continue to prosper and it will increase the family's income. The borrower is one of our trustworthy clients and repaid each loan installment on schedule without any delay.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and beer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as a visionary. 

She operates a school where she offers lower primary education. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are primary school students. She says her biggest business challenge is that running a school is a bit hectic. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stationery for her school. Her business goal is to expand the school by adding more classes within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stationery for her school.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 5 to 19 years. Teresia describes herself as self-driven and optimistic. She operates a drinks shop where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. Teresia describes her biggest business challenge as lack of funds for expansion. 

Teresia will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more drinks to sell. Her business goal is to own multiple businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to give her children the best education. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 32-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 months to 12 years. He operates a retail store where he sells soft drinks, cakes and mineral water. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be cold weather and the lack of capital. 

He will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of soft drinks, cakes, mineral water, bread and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of soft drinks, cakes, mineral water, bread and other items.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 31-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 4 years and 6 years. He describes himself as honest and patient. 

He operates a clothes retail store where he sells men's trousers. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to open a boutique within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 31 year old married man. He has two children ages 1 year and 3 years. He describes himself as honest and patient. 

He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are men, ladies and school children. He describes his biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tailoring materials like needles, cloth sheets, threads, etc. His business goal is to open another shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials like needles, cloth sheets, threads, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair food, chemicals, weaves, and wigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as honest and trustworthy. She operates a drinks shop where she sells soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy more drinks to sell like Coca Cola, Sprite, etc. Her business goal is to open a distribution channel within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for sale like Coca Cola, Sprite, etc.

loans.name: Maurice Otieno

texts.en:
Maurice is a Kenyan man, aged 42. He is married with four children. He runs a soft drinks sales business. The business is situated in a bus terminus that is very busy, and his customers are travelers. He has been in the business for 11 years. He says that the business is good, and the major challenges he has are financial constraints, changes of weather and the escalating prices of commodities. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to increase stock of soft drinks to meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He also hopes to grow his cafe by putting up a permanent premises to run it in the future. He describes himself as God-fearing, aggressive, responsible, honest and humble. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman. She has a child who is 4 years old. She describes herself as ambitious. Mary operates a phone repair shop where she repairs mobile phones. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as economic instability. 

Mary will use this KES 20,000 loan to boost her business by buying phone repair equipment, etc. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy phone repair equipment

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 60-year-old married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be business motivated. She operates a cereals store where she sells maize and millet. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a favorable area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in prices. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of maize and millet. Her business goal is to expand the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of maize and millet.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 56-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 years to 38 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and determined. 

She operates a cereals shop and a posho mill where she sells maize and beans and mills maize. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of maize. Her business goal is to package maize flour with her own brand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business and family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of maize.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim would like to take another loan to buy a greater quantity of netting materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs to sell to wholesalers. Tim's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of netting materials to make better-quality bathing scrubs.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as household items and confectionery, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products such as household items and confectionery.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh, 35 years old, is married and has one child. She supports her family through the income she earns from selling articles of plastic. She has had this business for five years. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Hanh intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a greater variety and quantity of plastic items. This will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a greater variety and quantity of plastic items.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 59, is widowed and has four children: two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business twenty years ago. She sells sugar, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 44 years old and married. She and her husband have been running an aluminium and glass shop in front of her door for 10 years. They started this business to cover their family's expenses and raise their children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Oanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying materials such as aluminium frames and glass to make cupboards and shop-windows to sell, allowing her to increase sales.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials such as aluminum and glass.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 41, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by producing ice for selling. They have been running this business since 2005. 

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying materials and tools to make and increase her production of ice. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for her production of ice.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 33, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income by sewing and providing seasonal labour for nearby companies. Mai started this business thirteen years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying sewing materials and paying for her children's education.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai is a 62-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. For three years, she has run a billiards shop that serves people in her community.

Gai would like a loan to purchase a better quality billiard table and soft drinks. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality billiard table and soft drinks.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is 35 years old and is married. He has a son and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker in a local company.

He has run a general store at his house for 7 years. He sells milk, beverages, confectionery, and household items. He intends to use his loan to buy many kinds of food products to sell such as sugar, cooking oil, and sanitation items.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of food products to sell such as sugar, cooking oil, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 49 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling pork and fish for more than five years, making an income of $5 daily. Her husband is employed in an ice producing company. He makes an income of $4 per day. Three of her children are employed. They make an income of $13 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pheap is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more pork and fish to sell. By doing so, she would make more profit to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree. In addition, she wants to improve her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pork and fish to sell

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Sarorn is 55 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are garment workers. They earn about $17 each day. 

Due to the lack of funds, Sarorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a comfortable house and provide better living conditions for her family. 

In the future, she would like to run grocery store at home to generate additional income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Naram

texts.en: Naram is 41 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than five years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is a fisherman who makes an income of $4 each day to help cover the family’s expenses. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about $6 per day. Due to lack of funds, Naram is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timbers to build a new house. This purchase will enable her to finish building her house and help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to build a new house

loans.name: Tunashukuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Simweray est conseillère du groupe d’affaire  « Tunashukuru», jeune entrepreneur courageuse, âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un mécanicien. La cliente est vendeuse de pommes de terre et de boissons sucrées (Fanta, Coca). Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, Il y a environ 7 ans. Les pertes liées aux pourritures de pommes de terre, la casse de bouteille sont des  grands défis pour ses activités. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 5 sacs de pommes de terre et 10 casiers de Fanta. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser ses enfants et construire en matériaux durable. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The client Simweray is an adviser to the business group "Tunashukuru." She is a brave young entrepreneur, 31 years old, married and mother to 4 children who all study. Her spouse is a mechanic. The client is a seller of potatoes and sweet drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola). She sets up her products at the public market and sometimes at her home. She started her business with a loan from the MFI Hekima, about 7 years ago. Losses due to rotting potatoes and broken bottles are great challenges for her businesses. This new loan will be used to buy 5 bags of potatoes and 10 cases of Fanta. Thus, she hopes to grow her capital, school her children and build with durable materials. Finally, she hardily thanks Hekima for its microloan support of small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of potatoes and 10 cases of Fanta.

loans.name: Tram

texts.en:
Tram, 52, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a beverages agent for 5 years. 

Tram is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of beverages to sell to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 36-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children in Ho Chi Minh City. To support her family, Phuong earns an income by running a business of producing and selling shoes. She started this business fifteen years ago. 

Phuong would like to take a loan to expand her current business. With the loan she will buy leather materials and accessories for producing a greater variety and quantity of shoes. 

Phuong hopes that, through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy leather materials and shoe accessories for producing shoes.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 30, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income making and selling shoes. Mai runs a fruit and vegetable store.

Mai started this business six years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of fruit and vegetables to better satisfy her customers, and also buy materials for her husband to make shoes.

She hopes her family's business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to better satisfy her customers and shoe materials for her husband to make shoes.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong would like to take another loan to buy a larger quantity of garlic and onions to increase production.

Hong's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more garlic and onions to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of oranges and watermelon.

loans.name: Pacificah

texts.en:
Pacificah runs a retail shop in Malindi, Kenya, where she lives. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. She also runs a daycare for children, which earns her extra income. She has one employee. 

She is asking for a loan to buy retail commodities for her shop like milk, bread, sugar, tea leaves, flour and cereals. She really believes in her daycare business and has great vision for it. She hopes that one day, it will become a primary school. She wants to give her children the best education that they can get, and that is the motivation that drives her everyday.

loans.use: to buy retail commodities for her shop like milk, bread, sugar, tea leaves, flour and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal, cooking oil, meat and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a wife and a mother of a 2-year-old child. She operates a clothes shop in her neighborhood. This has been her business for the last one year. She knew of Milango through friends at a time when she needed to access credit. 

She is now seeking a loan to buy more handbags, curtains and other retail material for her shop. She also has a mobile transfer business popularly known as M-Pesa in Kenya. The challenge that she is facing in the business is competition from other businesses. She will save the money she raises from the loan for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy more handbags and curtains.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La Sra. Francisca es una mujer de 39 años y  trabaja desde hace 15 años para una dentista reconocida aquí en la localidad. Ella está separada pero su ex esposo le da pensión alimenticia cada mes. Ella siempre ha soñado con terminar de construir su casa y es por eso que necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder ampliar su habitación y que quede como a ella le gustaría.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 39 year old woman who has worked for a well-known dentist in her neighbourhood for 15 years. She is separated, but her ex-husband pays her alimony every month.

She has always wanted to finish constructing her house. That is why she needs Kiva's assistance to expand her room so that it is completed as she would like.

loans.use: to expand a room in her home.

loans.name: Chamraeun

texts.en: Chamraeun is 39 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making flower pots to sell for more than five years, making an income of $2 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and earns about $5 per day. Due to lack of funds, Chamraeun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase timber and zinc to build her house. This money will help her complete her house construction and provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to build her house

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth is 43 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and vegetables for more than a year, earning approximately $5 each day. Her husband brings fish to sell around the village. He also makes an income of $5 per day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $10 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Reth is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase pork and fish to sell. This purchase will help her make more profit. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pork and fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 24 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in a garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her mother who is joining her in the picture is a rice farmer and makes bamboo baskets to sell. She makes an income of $3 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sokha is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase timber to build her house’s wall. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand the farming business to make more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build her house's wall

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang is 53 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband runs a business of making metal doors and metal windows to sell. He makes an income of $8 daily. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $3 per day. 

To improve her husband's business, Nang is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase metal and arc welding sticks to use for making more doors and windows. This money will help him obtain enough materials to use in his business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children have higher education.

loans.use: to purchase metal and arc welding sticks to use for making more doors and windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some flour, sugar, cereals and milk.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells maize flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil etc. Her business is located in an area favorable for business and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add a stock of maize flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil etc. Her business goal is to be well established within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will thrive well in the business and live a comfortable life. 

She will use the anticipated profits to pay the loan and expand the business.

loans.use: to add a stock of maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She sells porridge and fried potatoes at the local market. This has been her business for the last one year. The 35-year-old mother of six owns rental houses, which provides her with extra income. She has a vision of growing her business into a restaurant in the future. The challenges that she has been facing include competition and financing her business. 

The loan will enable her to give her children the best education in the country. She is now asking for a loan to purchase a bag of potatoes and flour.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of potatoes and flour.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly lives in Kongowea Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. For more than ten years she has been running a retail shop in her neighborhood. She also owns a mobile money transfer service known as "M-Pesa" She knew Milango (the Kiva field partner) through friends who introduced her and now she seeks a loan to buy a charcoal burner. She wants to fully venture into a real estate business and that is where she is heading in the next five years. The main challenges that she faces in her business are high transportation costs and debtors who refuse to pay her. The income she will raise will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy a charcoal burner.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias sells motorcycle spare parts in Mombasa Kenya where he also lives. The thirty-five-year-old father of two seeks a loan to buy spare parts to add stock to his business. 

He says he heard of Milango from a friend and then joined. The income he gets from the business will help him stabilize the business. He has been in this business for two years now and the challenges he faces mostly is competition from other traders in the same business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100kg of fish

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang is 52 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. They have been growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $11 per day.

Due to the difficulty in her family's transportation, Leang is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce family's transportation expenses. In the future, she wants to build fence around her house and help her youngest child get higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Divinah

texts.en: Divinah is a 42-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 to 18 years. She describes herself as hopeful. She operates a tailoring shop where she repairs clothes and makes clothes to sell. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of materials. She will use this 25,000 KES loan buy tailoring materials like cloth sheets, thread and other items. She hopes that in the future she will be able to feed and educate her children comfortably. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 10,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials like cloth sheets, thread and other items.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man who describes himself as committed. For the past four years, he had operated a general shop where he sells foodstuffs, detergent, and beverages. Patrick's business is located in a convenient area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate capital to expand. 

Patrick is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy  more rice to sell. This will be his second loan with SMEP DTM and he successfully repaid his previous 20,000 KES loan. Patrick's business goal is to open another store within five years and he hopes that, in the future, he will be self-reliant.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as aggressive. Peris operates a boutique where she sells shoes, trousers, dresses, and skirts. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a suitable area and her primary customers are mostly ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds to expand. 

Peris will use this KES 15,000 loan to add stock of dresses, shoes, and skirts for resale. Her business goal is to be well established within five years. She hopes that in the future she will benefit fully from her business.

loans.use: to add stock of dresses, shoes, and skirts for resale

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga lives in Changamwe near Mombasa Kenya. For more than ten years he has been selling charcoal in his neighborhood. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. He has an ambition of having five charcoal outlets where he will be able to reach the maximum number of customers. 

At the end of the loan term he expects to be able to pay his children's school fees and also improve the standards of living of his family. The challenge in this business is the weather. During rainy seasons it is difficult to get charcoal and if you get it, it is very expensive which cuts his income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, maize and beans and also renovate his cafeteria.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is divorced and has nine children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She sells soft drinks in Emina (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family.
