Currently, he is requesting this loan to continue his animal husbandry business - to purchase bulls to fatten and resell.

loans.use: to purchase bulls to fatten and resell

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala owns a small and beautiful farm, which she takes care of with great pleasure and enthusiasm. She keeps four pigs and six chickens. Together with her husband and two children, who are already grown up, Lala does her best to earn income. She sells agricultural products locally for profit, which unfortunately, is barely enough for covering the minimal cost of living for the family.

Realizing that this farm income is very important for her family, Lala wants to enlarge her farming activities. By requesting this loan, she plans to purchase two oxen, a pig, and forage for feeding them. Lala has big plans about her farm, and this loan from SEF International will be a good start toward reaching her goals.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen, a pig, and forage for feeding them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 36-year-old woman living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 3 children and her husband is working as a carpenter. The monthly income of her husband is insufficient to meet the household expenses due to the large family size, therefore Shazia is helping her husband by doing her own business. She has been successfully running her business of selling ornamental items for 8 years.

Shazia is a member of a two-person group and she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She would purchase a large quantity and new varieties of bangles, bracelets, necklaces, key chains and other ornamental items and sell them at profit. This could increase her sales, monthly income and savings, and she could support her family in better way. She is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental items for selling purposes

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 35-year-old married housewife who is living with her husband and two sons in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2007 her husband has been running a shoe shop in the market while she herself sells shoes at home as well. Her elder son has completed his graduation recently.

Robina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to purchase more varieties of shoes for the shop so that they can increase their sales and net income. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of shoes

loans.name: Elisa Clementina

texts.es: Doña Elisa, es una señora trabajadora que siempre ha luchado para darles lo básico a sus hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y formaron su propio hogar, trabaja como conserje desde hace 4 años, con sus ingresos intenta salir adelante pagando sus gastos principales del hogar.                                                                                                Solicita un 2do crèdito para garantizar la compra de materiales de construcción los cuales cada vez van aumentado su precio mediante pasa el tiempo, con esto podrá ir poco a poco mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda ubicada en el Coral, una zona a 80 minutos de Juigalpa Chontales, donde la mayor parte de sus pobladores son humildes campesinos.
texts.en:
Elisa is a hard-working woman that has always struggled to give the basics to her children, who are already older and have their own homes. She has worked as a janitor for 4 years. With her income she is trying to pay for the major household expenses.
She is requesting a second loan to guarantee the purchase of construction materials which becomes more expensive with time. With this, she will be able to little by little improve the infrastructure of her housing located in Coral, a zone 80 minutes from Juigalpa Chontales where the majority of the population are humble farmers.

loans.use: to purchase materials like cement, sand, iron, blocks, and rocks.

loans.name: Edith Abigail

texts.es: Doña Edith, en la actualidad es una mujer  soltera, que busca como salir adelante con sus hijos y sus sobrinos los cuales todos están bajo su cargo, cubre los gastos con su trabajo ahora como contadora en un hospital el cual lleva muchos años, su único medio de ingresos. Edith solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cemento, bloques entre otros para reparar su garaje el cual se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en: Edith is currently single and is trying to move forwards with her children, nephews and nieces, who are all under her care. She covers her expenses with her job as an accountant in a hospital, which she has done for many years and is her only source of income. Edith is requesting this loan to buy building materials such as zinc, sand, cement, blocks and others to repair her garage, which is in a state of disrepair.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as zinc, sand, cement and others.

loans.name: Kathya De La Cruz

texts.es: Kathya, es una persona responsable soltera, aun no tiene hijos, trabaja en el sector salud como contadora con sus ingresos apoya a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Ella desea con este crédito comprar láminas de zinc, pagar mano de obra y otros materiales de construcción para terminar de construir un cuarto para contar con privacidad el cual está realizando en casa de su mamá donde habita. El mayor sueño de Kathya es poder tener su casa propia, quien espera algún día hacerlo realidad poco a poco con apoyo de financiamiento.
texts.en: Kathya is a responsible single woman; she does not have any children yet.  She works in the health sector as an accountant and uses her income to help her mother with household expenses.  She wants to use this loan to buy metal sheeting and other building supplies and to pay labor costs to build a room in her mother’s house where she lives so that she can have some privacy.  Kathya’s greatest dream is to own her own house and hopes with financial support to do so little by little.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Señor De La Agonia De Taray Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Pilar ella es casada, tiene 46 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta como manzanas, platanos, mandarinas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de plátanos y manzanas para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de joyería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ropa, artesanía y negocio de venta de aretes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SEÑOR DE LA AGONIA DE TARAY” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Pilar, who is a married 46 year old with 5 children. The member alternates her daily activities with her business in selling fruit like apples, bananas and mandarins, among others. She has had her business for a long time and it is going well thanks to the work that she invests every day in her business. The member works at the same time raising small animals like guinea pigs. She wishes to continue working so that she can support her family in this way. 

She is seeking a loan in order to buy bananas and apples for her business.

The other members have a jewelry business, a grocery store business, a business selling clothing, a craft shop and a business selling earrings.

The member thanks those who are part of this dream through these means and promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the time established.

loans.use: to buy bananas and apples for her business.

loans.name: Paula Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Paula, continúa su labor como docente, una humilde señora que busca como salir adelante junto su esposo, sus hijos mayores de edad, solamente una continúa la universidad cursando la carrera de medicina y ella la apoya económicamente para que pueda culminar los estudios. Paula solicita el crédito para cerrar una parte del techo que esta descubierto y cuando llueve el agua se mete al interior de la casa provocando incomodidad a la familia, es por eso que necesita hacer esta mejora para vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en: Paula continues working as a teacher.  She’s a humble woman who seeks ways to get ahead with her husband.  Her children are all adults and just one of them is still in university studying Medicine and she supports her economically so that she can finish her studies.  Paula’s asking for the loan to close off part of the roof that’s open because when it rains water gets into the interior of the house causing discomfort for the family; this is why she needs to make this improvement so that they can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Chullou Shg Group

texts.en:
Chullou SHG group comprises 10 die-hard tribal women from a village which is about 40 kms away from the main city of Imphal, which is one of the capital cities in the North-Eastern states of India.The group also show tireless efforts in their own special way to generate income for the family. 

Phalpi is the one of the group members and she is the featured borrower. She is pictured with raised hand. Her husband is a driver and managing the family's livelihood was difficult with three grown-up kids, who are already pursuing their graduation courses at Government College. She found a way to supplement the family income and joined Chullou SHG. She accessed a loan and started a piggery. 

Phalpi has been in the pig-selling business for more than a couple of years now. She initially purchased piglets and raised them. When the pigs were fully grown, she sold them in the village and in nearby villages. With the profit, she bought more piglets which include female piglets and male piglets, too.  When they were grown, she usually lets them mate and produce offspring.  The offspring are also sold and some are left to be raised. She was doing a good business with her piggery and also manages the house in the absence of her husband. With the success she had with the piggery, she is now planning to start a poultry farm. 

With the Kiva loan, she will purchase chicks and ducklings and start poultry-raising at the back of their house.  She dreams of owning the biggest poultry business in the village and also says, she will try her best to make her dreams come true.

She thanked WSDS and Kiva and says “God bless both Kiva and WSDS”. The rest of the group members are also engaged in piggery, poultry and vegetable-selling businesses.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, raise them and start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has been blessed with six children, all of whom are attending school. Emmanuel runs a local transport business, using a three-wheeled vehicle famously known as a "tuk-tuk," in Kenya. He has been doing this business for the past four years.

His vehicle broke down recently, and that why he is asking for a loan. He will use the loan to buy parts and to repair the vehicle. He learned about Milango through friends. The major challenges that he faces now, are the high cost of financing and fewer customers who are choosing to use this kind of transport.

His ambition for the future, is to own a car rental company. The loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy parts and repair the tuk-tuk vehicle.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito tiene 23 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Cristina con quien tiene una pequeña hija de tan solo un año de edad y a quien le quieren dar lo mejor en la vida. El señor Benito trabajo para una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carretera y su esposa la señora Cristina es empleada de un centro comercial como cajera. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para realizar una mejora a su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta cambiar el cable eléctrico de toda la casa porque el actual esta en muy malas condiciones y prefieren evitar accidentes, como puede ser un incendio.
Con el sueldo que reviene el señor Benito es para pagar el crédito ya que con el ingreso de la señora Cristina es para los gastos familiares.
Desea mejorar el patrimonio y que su hija tenga un lugar seguro para su crecimiento ya que es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
Sr. Benito is 23 years old and married to Sra. Cristina. They have a young daughter who is only a year old, so they want to give her the best in life.

Sr. Benito works for a transportation company as a truck driver and his wife Cristina works as a cashier at a shopping center. They are requesting a loan in order to make an improvement to their home. They plan to replace all of the electric cables throughout their house because the current ones are in very bad condition. Benito and his family want to avoid accidents, such as a fire.

With the salary he earns, Sr. Benito will be able to repay the loan while Sra. Cristina’s income will be used for family expenses. Benito wants to improve his homestead so that his daughter will have a safe place where she can grow up since she is very young.

loans.use: to replace the cables throughout his house so that electricity can be installed.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
A loan of $2,175 helps Fernando to expand his client base to increase his profit margins. 

Fernando is a dedicated entrepreneur. Originally from Brazil, he has lived in the United States for over 10 years with his wife and 2 children. For years he had worked long hours in the construction industry with minimal vacation time. Six years ago, he built up his pool maintenance business from scratch by purchasing a set of schedules of houses. Fernando is, and always has been, the sole owner, partner, and employee of Boca Blue Service, Inc, also known as “Nando’s Pool”. 

What he enjoys most about being self-employed is a higher quality of life and flexibility. He envisions a time in which he can generate enough revenue to hire an additional staff member to do the pool maintenance, which would allow him to focus exclusively on managing the business.

loans.use: to increase profit margins through expansion of client base

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 50-year-old widowed woman. She has a child who is 20 years old. She describes herself to be spiritual. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy a stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to open additional outlets within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to save for her child's education.This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid back successfully.

loans.use: buy a stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to establish credit for the first time in the United States

loans.name: Santos Alejandrina

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 57 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Santos no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta asistir a su iglesia para agradecer por sus bendiciones y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
 Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Santos trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pasteles, tanto de pollo y queso, adicionalmente también trabaja brindando servicios de jardinería en una empresa municipal de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Santos se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales como calaminas, clavos, madera y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder refaccionar el techado y paredes de su vivienda, de esta manera Santos tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran pastelería.
texts.en:
Santos is 57 years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic woman, who puts all of her effort into succeeding. Unfortunately, because of a lack of money and the need to work from a young age, Santos was unable to study for a professional career. In her free time, she likes going to her church to give thanks for her blessings, and sometimes she makes delicious Ceviche to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with a lot of commitment and dedication, Santos works in her small business selling chicken and cheese pies. She also works as a gardener in a municipal company in her city. She works for around 10 hours every day and thinks that she is doing well due to the kind way in which she treats others.
Santos is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the support they give, she will be able to make improvements to her home. She wants to buy materials such as corrugated iron sheets, nails, wood and others, which will be very useful for remodeling the roof and walls of her home. In this way, Santos will have greater security and wellbeing, and she will keep working and making an effort to achieve her biggest dream of owning a great bakery.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 33-year-old married man. He has two children aged 3 years and 7 years old. He describes himself to be honest and a go-getter. He operates a tailor shop where he makes clothes to sell and also repairs clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. He also operates a motorcycle transport business to earn extra income. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are local residents. 

Duncan describes his biggest business challenge to be that customers order clothes and then turn down their requests. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy two dairy cows. His business goal is to buy more sewing machines and employ five people within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land, develop it, and live happily with his family. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and put aside savings.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger amounts and varieties of fruit.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Marmarashen village, in the region of Shirak. She is married and has an 11-year-old daughter, who is in the photo with her. Mariam doesn't work, apart from taking care of her daughter, but in order to tackle financial hardships, Mariam is engaged in agriculture.  The family's livestock includes 4 cows and 50 chickens. They also own a plot of agricultural land, where wheat and potatoes are cultivated. Mariam's mother-in-law, who lives with them, helps her a lot with the agricultural work. She gives good advice on how to breed cattle and cultivate seeds.
 
Now, in order to enlarge her farm, Mariam is asking for a loan from SEF International. With the loan's help she will purchase two oxen, seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to cultivate more types of fruits and vegetables and earn more income. Mariam waits for your support!

loans.use: to enlarge her farm, by buying two oxen, seeds and fertilizer
